column1: full, a bit of shape in towards off stump, clipped to the left of midwicket and he's off the mark
lovely, length ball, threatens to swing back in briefly but ends up simply continuing its journey across the left-hander. Leaves it alone, playing a shadow defensive shot inside the line
fuller now, just outside off, and Harris gets a good stride forward to push into the cover point region
on the fullish side of a good length, slanting away from off stump, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, stabbed into the short cover region

gone, Siraj strikes in the first over, and Warner is gone playing an uncertain shot. Beautiful length and line, slanting across and ending up tight on off stump. I don't know if it's seamed away, or if it's just kept going with the angle with the batsman playing for swing into him. Warner has a feel for it without really getting a stride to the ball, and second slip dives in front of first to take an outstanding low catch. A little bit of away seam, and Rohit has taken a blinder, diving to his right
good ball to start, fullish, swinging away in the corridor, left alone
looks to go straighter, back of a length, ends up sliding it well down leg side. He's overstepped too.
length ball straightening towards off stump, defended back to the bowler
shortish, a bit of swing, but starts too wide to make Harris play
nice line, angling in towards off stump and straightening late. Extra bounce from a length, and Harris, looking to work it into the on side, is hit on the thigh pad
length ball on off stump, gets nicely behind it and blocks it back to the bowler
fuller, much wider, swings away quite considerably but it starts too wide to make Harris play
outswing in the corridor, left alone. Perhaps a touch shorter than the length that might have made Labuschagne play at it
a little fuller, gets that lovely away shape again in the corridor. Left alone

looks to get his line slightly straighter after those two leaves, and ends up a little too straight with the ball refusing to swing. I don't know whether he got any bat on that leg-side tuck, but there's certainly thigh pad on its way to the fine leg boundary
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball angling into middle and off, defended to midwicket
full, swinging away in the sixth-stump channel, left alone
full, angling into off stump, clipped to mid-on, who's stationed fairly wide. And Natarajan's overstepped again, though not by much on this occasion
length ball in the corridor, a little bit of shape away, left alone
on the fuller side of a length, in the fifth-stump channel. Gets a stride forward and leaves it
back of a length on off stump, defended towards that wide mid-on/straight midwicket fielder again

nice carry through to Pant, who takes it over his shoulder with fingers pointing up, after Harris leaves one outside off. Leaves it on length as much as line, because this was pretty close to off stump
too full, angling into middle stump, and Saini dives to his left at wide mid-on to stop a good-looking on drive
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball angling into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, angling into the stumps, gets on his toes to ride the bounce and play it down towards square leg
once again on the shorter side of a length, angling into middle stump or thereabouts. Rides the bounce and plays it down towards square leg
length ball, angling in and straightening just a touch towards off stump. Blocked back to the bowler
short now, angling into leg stump, gets back and across and pulls it away and finds the gap between square leg and long leg
fullish, angling into off stump, defended to mid-on
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped to long leg
slants the first one away from off stump, and Labuschagne leaves it alone. Decent length, but not full enough to bring the batsman forward
nicely bowled, this one does bring Labuschagne forward. Leaves it again, but it's a testing length and angle. Perhaps some late swing just before it reaches the keeper too
full, at the stumps, punched back to the bowler who dives to his left to stop it in his follow-through
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, left alone
ooh, good ball. Similar length to the previous one, but the line is closer to off stump, and it may have seamed away off the deck too. Watched well and left well
short, slanting away and offering width too, but there's too much bounce for Harris to connect with the cut. Had to reach for it too
length ball, pitching around off stump and continuing with the angle across. Left alone
back of a length on off stump, gets on top of the bounce and defends with soft hands, into the off-side V
length ball slanting away into a wide line outside off, left alone

good ball, testing line close to off stump, and with the inward angle and the length, he's not sure whether to play or leave. Gets on the front foot and makes a late decision to leave, and leaves his bat close enough to the line for the ball to hit the inside edge and nearly ricochet into his stumps
back of a length, angling into the stumps, gets across and tucks it to long leg
length ball slanting into the corridor outside off, left alone

nicely bowled. Slanted across again, perhaps a little fuller than the previous ball, and this one nips away off the seam. He's mid-shuffle while he defends, but he plays close to the body and the ball rolls along the floor to gully off the outside half of the bat
full, slanting away from off stump, left alone
length ball, pitching just within the line of the stumps and continuing with the angle across. Left alone
length ball, leg-stumpish. Looks to work it into the leg side but gets tangled up with the angle and is hit on the thigh pad
length ball, slanting into the fifth-stump channel, left alone

and he strikes first ball! His 11th ball in Test cricket. Unusual dismissal, Harris flicks one off his legs, in the air, and straight to the man at square leg, stationed just in front of square. We'll have to watch that again to see if the ball did anything unusual, or if he just played a loose shot. Just seemed like an airy flick of fa pretty full ball that was swinging marginally into him. May have wanted to play that further in front of square?
fullish, swings away in the corridor outside off, left alone
full, angling down leg, and Smith shuffles too far across to be able to flick it
quite full, angling into the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
length ball outside off, left alone
low full-toss, almost seemed like an attempted yorker on off stump. Punched firmly, but off the toe end of the bat, to the right of mid-off
length ball outside off, left alone
good leave. Left that on length. Length ball, pitching within the stumps and angling away from Smith, and that wasn't too far wide of off stump, but bounced well over
this one's fuller but the line's slightly wider. Leaves it again
full, angling across to off stump, and Smith steps across to clip it wide of mid-on
back of a length, angling across the stumps. Shuffles across and tucks this wide of mid-on, having met it slightly outside off stump. Nicely played
fullish, angling across and maybe straightening a touch towards off stump. Presses forward and blocks it back down the pitch
back of a length, fairly wide of off stump, left alone
full outside off, a hint of away swing, so Labuschagne doesn't go with the full-blooded drive. Checked punch to short extra-cover
ooh, loose drive, play and miss. Not full enough for that at all, and a bit of away swing too. Quite wide of off stump, and that's what drew the stroke
back of a length, close to off stump, hits the deck hard and gets steep bounce. Left alone
a bit of away swing again, from just back of a length, but starts too wide to make Labuschagne play
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, leaves it again
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone

full on off stump, and Smith drives through cover point. The length was full enough for it, but his weight wasn't fully forward and his bat turned in his hands on impact. May have wanted to hit that straighter
fullish, slanting across and finishing close to off stump, presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
back of a length, angling across into the fourth-stump channel. Left alone
full on middle stump, clipped to the right of Saini, who fumbles at wide mid-on to turn a tight single into a comfortable two. Seemed to run in too quickly and almost overran the ball
length ball, slanting away into a wide line outside off, left alone
full outside off, a bit of away shape. Gets a good stride forward and punches it firmly back to the bowler
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
too full, on middle and off, and Smith likes it there, whips it away to the right of wide mid-on to pick up a crisp boundary
shot. Full again from Thakur, outside off this time, and this isn;t reckoned to be one of Smith's strong areas, but he gets forward and leans into the perfect drive through square cover
back of a length on leg stump, steps across and tucks it to the left of long leg
a bit of swing, but it starts faaaaar too wide to make Smith play
that goes a bit wrong! Short of a length, angled down the leg side, evades everyone including a diving Pant. To be fair, that might have hit a crack
back of a length, takes the thigh pad to the on side
good length at off stump, 131kph, defended towards point
shorter on off stump, on his toes and defends
dragged down short, Labuschagne goes for the pull but completely mistimes it towards midwicket
back of a length outside off, 136kph, left alone and through to Pant at waist height
back of a length outside off, Smith well across the crease and defends
fuller, Smith comes forward, defended into the covers
touch wider outside off, left alone
short outside off, Smith stands tall and drives off the back foot to cover
fuller, some nice shape away on this one, 138kph, Smith shoulders arms
full, moves away a touch, wide enough for Smith to allow it through
good length at off stump, 135kph, defended back to the bowler
short, pushed down the leg side, Labuschagne gets across inside the line to allow it through
back on a full length at off stump, 136kph, defended to the off side
works this around the corner, cut off by the fielder at leg gully, bottom hand came off the bat
short of a length, angled in at off stump, defended into midwicket
in the channel outside off, left alone, and that's three maidens in a row
full outside off, swings away, brings Smith into a drive, the feet didn't quite move and it squirts off a thick inside edge to the leg side
full outside off, leaves this one well alone
short of a length, 138kph, straighter, tucked into the leg side
length ball outside off, 138kph, keeping the pressure on Smith as this one is left alone
fuller at the stumps, defended with a shuffled into midwicket
on the pads, flicked backward of square but can't beat the fielder. Another maiden. Australia being dotted up.
and there's a run, tucks a straight delivery into square leg and finds a gap
at the stumps, clipped off the pads down to fine leg, well out of reach of the leg gully
well bowled! That's a good one. In the channel outside off, makes him play and beats the outside edge
full and straight, neatly clipped wide of mid-on
full at off stump, 134kph, defended on the front foot
great shot! Best of the day so far. Gets a stride forward and drills a straight drive back past the stumps. Hold the pose for that one
short of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to cover
a rare short ball, around leg stump, pulled down to fine leg
back of a length outside off, 138kph, left alone
angled into the pads, worked into midwicket
gets away with this! Not in control. It's full outside off, Smith goes for the drive and it flies off a thick outside edge through backward point
that's more like...fully in control of this one, comes forward into a full delivery outside off and eases it straight of mid-off. Very nice
back of a length, defended
good stride forward, a very solid block to the off side
short of a length, outside off at 135kph, left alone
makes him play this time, a fraction fuller and more at off stump, takes a thickish outside edge towards gully but well controlled
angled in at the stumps, clipped to square leg
good length at off stump, Labuschagne nearly gets a leading edge on this as the bat turns
full outside off, defended
full outside off, works this to mid-on although not entirely sure that's where he meant
pushed down the leg side
nicely bowled, hint of shape in at off stump, defended to the on side
full outside off, this one shades away from Smith, left alone...nice variation from Thakur
cracked away! Too short and too much width this time, Smith square drives between point and cover
full outside off, 136kph, left alone
length ball wide outside off, left alone
touch fuller and closer to off stump, Labuschagne leaves alone
keeps it full outside off, through to the keeper
hangs it full outside off, 137kph, Labuschagne happy to watch it go through
outside off, through to the keeper, not an overly threatening over but a maiden to tighten things up
pushed into the pads, worked to short leg
tucked backward of square on the leg side
pushed down the leg side, Smith misses his sweep, neat take from Pant
he plays back, works a straight delivery to the leg side
fuller, Smith goes for the sweep, this bobbles to the off side maybe off his arm
well bowled! The straighter one, takes the outside edge as Smith is square up and runs to point. Nice start from Sundar
defended to the on side
short and wide, driven square off the back foot, deep point is in action but they get back for a second
full outside off, left alone, Pant takes this at shoulder height. Nice carry
outside off, 138kph, good length and left alone
back of a length, angled in at off stump, defended to the on side
a shorter delivery, Labuschagne plays back and tucks into midwicket to keep the strike
worked into the leg side
slips this down the leg side, there's half an appeal for a tickle
flicked off the pads but can't beat the man at backward square
worked towards short leg
pads this away to the on side
pushed outside leg stump, Labuschagne again thrusts his pad at it
worked off the pads to midwicket
gets a long way across the crease, squeezes a full delivery down to long leg. Bowler has his hands on his head
full outside off, 140kph, left alone
full at off stump, defended firmly back to the bowler
full again, driven hard into the pitch and Saini parries it towards mid-on with his right hand
keeps it up at off stump, 135kph, defended
outside leg stump, turned around the corner to backward square
worked wide of short leg this time and can't find a gap
at the stumps, defended on the back foot and takes an inside edge to the leg side
fuller, he leans forward and defends with bat well in front of pad
worked off the pads to short midwicket
angled into the pads, Smith kicks it away, the ball runs to fine leg but no shot played so that's a dot to end the session
back of a length close to off stump. Hops to ride the bounce and defend into the gully region
appeal for lbw as Labuschagne misses a flick, playing around his front pad a little. Not the most vociferous shout. Possibly going over the stumps

fullish, angling into off stump, maybe some late inswing too. Clipped away through forward square leg. Everything's nice and comfortable until there's a bit of relay fielding on the  boundary, and a slight mix-up between the two batsmen, but the first throw goes to the keeper's end when the other end may have possibly caused some alarms. In the end they pick up an all-run four
back of a length, angling down leg, too far from Labuschagne's hip to make contact with the flick
length ball outside off, left alone
full on off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
back of a length, angling into off and middle, goes back and across to block into the on side
fairly full on off stump, stays back and blocks to mid-on
length ball, angling down leg slightly. Looks to work it away, and it slides past his bat and hits thigh pad
once again a touch too straight, tucked off the hip to fine leg
length ball angling into off stump, steps across to tuck it quietly to backward square leg

nicely placed. There's a leg gully and a man at square leg, and Smith steps across to pick this one off from pretty close to the top of off stump, and tuck it away into the gap between the two fielders
fullish, angling into off stump, defended towards short cover
too full, but Smith won't get any runs for this smooth drive, as Gill throws himself to his right at short cover to make a one-handed stop
back of a length on leg stump, gets on top of the bounce and keeps it down in front of leg gully
length ball in the corridor, left alone
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
back of a length in the corridor, and Smith ignores it
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
length ball angling into middle stump, steps across and clips towards long leg
length ball close to off stump, presses half-forward and blocks it back to the bowler
full outside off, opens his bat face and stabs into the cover point region. It was right up there, fuller than a driving length, and there may have been a bit of late away swing
length ball angling into off stump, defended towards mid-on
length ball angling into off stump, steps across and defends to midwicket
short on off stump, gets up to just over waist high, and that presents no problems for Labuschagne, who swivels on his back foot to pull it between square leg and the square-leg umpire

full outside off, punched to mid-on. He may have been looking to drive that through the off side, but that went off the inside half of the bat, suggesting he may have been a touch late getting forward
back of a length in the corridor, left alone

nicely bowled. Length ball, not too far outside off, and steep bounce through to Pant, who collects over his right shoulder. Seemed to straighten just a touch too, and Labuschagne did well to leave it
fuller now, angling into off stump, presses forward to block it back to the bowler
strays into a middle-and-leg line, and Labuschagne works it to the right of square leg
is there a bit of late inswing there? Fullish length, homing in on off stump, gets right behind it to defend towards mid-on
length ball on off and middle, clipped towards square leg
back of a length and this one climbs awkwardly towards Smith's ribs, while possibly nipping into him. Drops his bottom hand and defends into the leg side
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length just outside off, gets on his toes for a push to the left of extra-cover
full, angling in towards off stump, blocked towards mid-on
looks for the short ball, but angles it down leg. Smith lifts his bat and gloves well above his head and steps across to evade it
short again, and again Smith steps across to the off side of the ball, this time to hook it along the ground to the left of fine leg
length ball angling into middle stump, gets across and clips wide of mid-on
back of a length on off stump or thereabouts, jumps back and across to defend towards mid-on
back of a length outside off, just a hint of width, and Smith punches crisply through cover point
back of a length outside off, a little wider than the previous ball, and Labuschagne chops down on it, on top of the bounce, to play it to backward point

and he gets Smith immediately! What a moment! What a player to get for your first wicket in Tests! It's the leg trap coming into effect again. Not the most dangerous-looking delivery, full and almost fired into the pads, but Smith flicks uppishly, and straight to the fielder at short midwicket. He's utterly cross with himself as he walks back to his dressing room
testing delivery, quickish and on a good length, just outside off. Leaves it, and it bounces steeply through to Pant
tossed up a bit slower along a similar line, gets a stride forward to block into the off side
tossed up a little wider, gets forward to drive firmly to short extra
flatter, slides on towards off stump, goes on the back foot to block it back where it came from
short and wide, and Wade puts it away, cuts firmly to the point boundary
full, angling down leg, not close enough to the batsman to be able to flick it
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
short, angling quite a long way down the leg side, left alone
shortish, at the body, cramps him a little at around chest height and Labuschagne plays a short-arm pull through square leg

dropped! By Rahane of all people, at gully. Back of a length close to off stump, and it takes off out of nowhere as Labuschagne goes back and across to defend. Thick edge high on the bat, and it pops straight into Rahane's hands at waist height, and then pops straight out
short, wide, slow, takes an age to get to Labuschagne, who lets it come to him and slaps to deep point
flat length ball spinning towards leg stump, goes back and works it into the square leg region
quickish offbreak on a length outside off, presses forward and blocks with an open face into the cover point region
brings him forward with another quickish one outside off, this time he gets closer to the pitch of it and smothers it
a touch too full, but driven straight to cover point
full again, drives towards mid-off and calls immediately for one. The fielder had to run forward and towards his left there, away from his throwing arm
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to jab into the covers
full, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick
big appeal for lbw as he goes wide of the crease and makes Labuschagne play around his front pad while trying to flick a full one. Not given, not reviewed. Was probably going down leg
wide of the crease again, angles a length ball in towards off stump and it's blocked back towards the bowler
full, angling in towards leg stump, clipped to square leg
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets behind it and clips it to the right of midwicket to bring up Australia's 100
full, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick and Pant dives to his right to collect
full, angling into the stumps, clipped with the turn to midwicket
shot. That's just short of a length, and probably turning down the leg side, but Marnus makes a ton of room with quick feet, and chops it behind point
flat length ball on middle and leg, defended into the on side
back of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
tossed up a little slower, spinning in from off stump. Blocked back to the bowler
flat and quick, slanting down leg, clipped to backward square leg
full, close to off stump, gets forward to block into the cover point region
back of a length, angling into leg stump, tucked away to long leg
fullish, angling into off stump. Labuschagne is already standing out of his crease. Skips out a couple more steps and blocks towards mid-on
banged in short outside off, leaves it and then plays a shadow pull
full, angling into off stump from wide of the crease, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
leans back and square drives to cover
lovely bowling! Full this time, lures Wade into a drive and beats the edge. Loose from Wade as well
tighter this time, bat and pad together as he defends
wider outside off, goes on with the arm, left alone
angled in at off stump, Wade leans well forward to defend
opts for the sweep this time, full outside off, dragged to deep square leg
over the wicket, full at off stump, flicked to mid-on...and it's a no-ball
back of a length outside off, 133kph, played to cover
defends from off stump to mid-on
a length delivery nips back in at Wade, beating an attempted flick shot and taking the pad
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length, through to the keeper...needs to be a touch fuller
well, maybe not that full...serves up a juicy half volley outside off which Wade takes advantage off by driving perfectly through the covers
over the wicket, flicked off the pads to square leg
drags this down short on the pads but it's not costly as Labuschagne picks out backward square
short again, but again it finds the man at backward square. That will annoy Marnus
tapped off the pads into midwicket, some uncertainty over the single but it was an easy one in the end
round the wicket, angled in at middle and off, straightens nicely and defended
full and defended back down the pitch
beaten! Comes round the wicket, it's back of a length and reasonably wide but Labuschagne is drawn into poking at it
this one angles in, played down into the leg side towards midwicket
touch fuller, at the stumps, played to midwicket
length ball from round the wicket, 135kph, Labuschagne is squared up a little
across on off stump, defended
fuller to end the over, driven to mid-off
full outside off, left alone
nicely bowled! This slides in from round the wicket, good bounce as well, left alone. Reasonably tight leave
more good bounce, Pant takes this on the rise
short of a length outside off, drives into the covers
gets it fuller again, left alone
pushed in at middle and leg, defended to the on side. Good pressure
stays round the wicket, good length outside off, left alone and this swings late as it reaches Pant
comes forward and drives to mid-off, not quite timed. Another no-ball. He's had a few problems today
back of a length, driven with a hint of flourish but finds cover
flicks this one to the on side from around off stump
finds the gap this time, gets forward and drives a full delivery through the covers although it won't reach the rope
dropped! Pujara at slip. He finds the edge, Labuschagne pushing forward, it's a very low and tough chance as he had to go handed. Don't think Pant could get across, but he did start to move for it
on the stumps, flicked into midwicket
defended to cover
full at the stumps, flicked to the right of mid-on and that's his fifty from 145 deliveries
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
power in this drive from Wade it doesn't beat mid-off
pushed to mid-on off the back foot and that's a well judged single with the fielder a little on his heels
threads the off side this time, frees his arms into a cover drive
outside off, left alone
angled in at off stump, defended
chases a wide delivery outside off with a square cut but the ball beats the top edge. Was there for the shot
length ball outside off, left alone
still not quite out of the middle, but it slots away this full delivery through the off side with a strong drive off the front foot
left alone outside off
round the wicket, left alone
touch shorter, he plays back and defends
slides through to the keeper
defended to silly point
fraction shorter and that's a neat stroke from Wade as he leans back and places through square cover...think it just gets flicked back inside the rope
on the stumps, defended
nice start, over the wicket, full at off stump and this straightens late on Wade who defends
short of a length at off stump, 134kph, defended
takes the outside edge, but runs wide of second slip, full outside off and brought Wade forward but he was just about able to keep the ball down
full at the stumps, played to mid-off
drags the length back, on middle and off, defended to the bowler in his followthrough
that's a poor delivery, low full toss outside off, Wade doesn't miss out as he drives through the covers
full at the pads, misses his attempted flick
good work at cover as Labuschagne drives strongly into the off side...Siraj prevents the boundary. Fifty stand between this pair
round the wicket, comes forward and defends to bat-pad fielder
left alone outside off
full outside off, defended
drives this time but finds mid-off
a strangled appeal for a catch down the leg side as Labuschagne pulls...heard something, must have been pad. Came off the hip, yep
short again and this time he doesn't miss out, a short-arm pull from around off stump, keeps it to ground through midwicket
short again, pulled again, four again...India just losing a bit of control. Labuschagne seeing it well now, pulls this backward of square with excellent placemengt
fuller but angled into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
full at middle and off, clipped strongly but straight to mid-on
good length at off stump, 137kph, defended
full, angled into the pads, goes for the sweep and gets a bottom edge that runs away very quickly to fine leg
comes round the wicket, length ball at the stumps, flicked into midwicket...the fielder, Shaw, throws it straight into Rohit Sharma!
square cut into the off side
taps a full delivery towards cover
strides forward and defends a good-length ball
over the wicket for the final ball of the over, pitches around middle and leg, hint of turn, defended
outside off, left alone
wider, through to the keeper
full outside off, driven to cover
full, clipped away through midwicket
in the channel, left alone outside off
back of a length outside off, driven to deep point
back of a length, makes a bit of room and punches to short extra-cover
down the track to a flighted ball on middle and leg, clipped quietly into the square leg region
floated across and pitching outside off, spinning further away from a fullish length. He isn't tempted into the drive
a touch shorter, goes back and across and defends in front of off stump, playing with soft hands behind square on the off side
full, at the left-hander's legs, clipped away through square leg
tossed up fairly full, angling away into that wide-ish line outside off. Leaves again
fullish, swinging away just a touch from off stump. Nice stride forward to punch it back to the bowler
length ball close to off stump, left alone
short, just a bit of width, but there's a man at deep backward point to mop up after Labuschagne cuts
shortish, at the hip, tucked away to long leg
fullish, slanting across and straightening towards off stump, stays on the back foot to block it back to the bowler
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended towards short extra-cover
flat length ball spinning towards leg stump, goes back and clips watchfully to short leg

super shot. He's been alert to any chance of Washington dropping marginally short. Skips back, makes plenty of room, and punches to the left of mid-off. No one in the covers, because the field is so leg-side oriented
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off
flat and full, close to off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball sliding on towards off stump, stays back and makes a bit of room to chop to backward point
full, angling into off stump, blocked towards short extra-cover
back of a length, not far from off stump, left alone
fullish, close to off stump, and that's nicely driven. Punches through the line and beats mid-off to his left
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, tucked away to the right of midwicket
full, angling across to off stump, driven to short extra-cover
back of a length on middle and off, worked away through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven to the right of mid-off

there again, makes a lot of room to a marginally short ball that's turning in towards leg stump, and chops it away through point. After the similar shot he played in the previous over, there's more protection in the covers for Washington
back of a length outside off, jabbed into the point region
back of a length outside off, from around the wicket, stabbed to point
flat length ball on middle and leg, gets forward to clip watchfully towards mid-on
full on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
length ball swinging away but starts too wide of off stump to make Labuschagne play
there's that outswing again, from a fuller length but the line is just as wide. Goes for the square drive but can't get it past point
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, there's plenty of width here, and Labuschagne gets his head on top of the ball to drive to the left of mid-off
stays back to a fairly full ball angling across to off stump, defends with soft hands. He's expecting swing into him, but it just goes with the angle, and it hits the outside half of his bat
full, a bit of late swing in towards off stump. Shows the full face and finds the gap to the right of mid-off
goes full again, on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, down leg, can't connect with the tuck off the hip
back of a length, angling into off stump, clipped into the gap between square leg and midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone
full, just outside off, good use of the wrists to work this wide of mid-on
full, close to off stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, defended with soft hands into the gully region
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended towards short midwicket
shortish, not enough width for the forcing shot through the covers. Ends up playing it back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
goes a little wider and gets the ball to swing away, but the line allows Labuschagne to leave with ease

lovely, lovely shot. Not a half-volley, it's full and angling into off stump with just a hint of shape away, and he just shows it the full face and sends it racing away between the umpire and the non-striker
half-volley on the pads, and Wade flicks it away gratefully to the square leg boundary
back of a length, slanting across the left-hander, gets across and uses his wrists to play it down into the on side
length ball angling across to off stump, defended back to the bowler
fullish, angling into off stump, defended back down the pitch
strays onto the pads again, and Wade clips to deep square leg

shot. Length ball outside off, and he's seeing it well enough to drive on the up now. As he well should, to go from 97 to 101, placing the ball into the gap between cover and mid-off. It's an all-run four, a super shot to bring up an excellent hundred. He's ridden his luck, but India have looked increasingly short of ideas against him
length ball outside off, punched to cover
back of a length, angling into the body and tucking up Wade, defended to midwicket
back of a length close to off stump, just lets it come on and punches on the up through cover point

gone, and Wade gives it away with an aggressive shot yet again. First wicket for Natarajan, and India desperately needed it. Wasn't short enough to pull, maybe, and the ball hurried onto Wade and cramped him for room. Ends up scooping it up rather than hitting it with a flat bat-swing, and the ball goes high, behind the bowler, where both mid-on and mid-off converge towards the ball. Mid-on manages to catch it just as the two fielders' paths cross, with the collision somehow averted. Shaw was the fielder at mid-off, and he just about stepped out of the way as Thakur got under the ball. Natarajan also seemed to be going towards the ball for a moment.
length ball, angling into middle and leg, clipped watchfully to midwicket
nice stride forward to punch this length ball, which is angling into the fourth-stump channel, to short extra-cover
length ball on off stump, defended back down the pitch
full outside off, driven firmly and Washington dives to his right at mid-off to stop it
back of a length close to off stump, steps across to block into the on side
back of a length outside off, steered to deep point

fullish, angling into off stump, and that's very well timed. Gets a big stride forward and times the weight transfer perfectly to pick up two runs to the right of mid-off with what was a mere defensive push
fuller still, and again he gets a nice stride into the ball to drive to the right of mid-off, left elbow high. This time it goes all the way
wow, that's not particularly short, just over stump high over off stump, and he swivels and pulls it away through square leg, to pick up another all-run four
full, fairly wide of off, driven wristily to short cover
shortish, angling into off stump, pulled to the left of deep square leg
overpitched outside off, and Labuschagne goes a touch too hard at this drive, and ends up leaning back as he hits it. Sliced to backward point - he was probably aiming to hit through the covers

the Natarajan short ball strikes again! He nailed a pull earlier this over off a not particularly short ball, and a similar response to a similar delivery ends up as a top edge on this occasion. Goes high in the air behind the wicket, and Pant jogs a few yards to his left to pouch it. The ball was only around waist-high, and Labuschagne ended up over-adjusting and hitting from down to up
back of a length outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, left alone
full, angling into off stump, blocked to mid-off
length ball, fairly wide of off, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length just outside off, defended into the covers
fullish, angling into off stump, good stride forward to block into the point region
fullish, slanting across to off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length, angling into middle stump, defended to midwicket
shot. Back of a length outside off, presses forward, lets the ball come on, and steers between gully and backward point

good ball, on the fuller side of a good length and angling into the stumps. Shows the full face to punch to mid-on, but he had planted his front leg quite solidly, and had to pull it back in a hurry to bring his bat down straight
back of a length outside off, blocked into the point region
and again, looks for that lbw ball. This one's fuller, and Green punches firmly back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
length ball close to off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched to mid-on. It's interesting that Paine has been defending or punching these balls with quite hard hands so early in his innings
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-on
back of a length close to off stump, punched to backward point
full, angling into off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length, angling into off stump, gets nicely behind it to defend into the on side
full, angling into off stump, blocked to short cover
there's that lbw ball again. Wide of the crease, angling into the stumps, and Green plays around that big front pad to clip it through square leg. And he's overstepped again, though not by much
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped to midwicket
beaten. Length ball outside off, not full enough for the cover drive. Goes at it with an angled bat and it zips past his outside edge

and he beats him again, with a better delivery. Length ball, angling into the corridor and straightening off the pitch. Green's bat comes down at an angle in defence, and he gets a little squared up too
down the leg side, clipped away fine and that runs away very quickly. Paine off the mark from his 13th delivery
flicked towards mid-on who is deep enough to allow the single
on off stump, comes forward and defends
fuller at off stump, flicked towards mid-on who cuts it off with a tumble
wider outside off, left alone
full at the stumps, defended
that's a lovely stroke, round the wicket and he leans forward into a strong on drive
short of a length, punched off the back foot to mid-off
fuller, driven to the left of mid-off
back of a length at off stump, 128kph, defended to the on side
defends a length delivery to the man at short mid-on
full outside off, big stride forward and a good-looking drive to mid-off
works this to mid-on who is tighter on the one this time
worked off the pads to backward square
shorter delivery, worked into space at midwicket
pushed off the pads to short leg
uses his feet and pushes to mid-on
plays back to a shorter delivery and knocks it into the leg side
nice start, full outside off, hint of shape and left alone
full at off stump, 135kph, Paine drives to mid-off
wider outside off, left alone
tighter to off stump, excellent delivery, and a good leave as well, able to trust the bounce at the Gabba
full and driven back up the pitch
full at off stump, 133kph, pushes into the off side, trying to find a single but mid-off is there
terrific shot! Uses his feet and then drives this in the air straight down the ground
worked through midwicket off the pads
flatter delivery on leg stump, worked into the on side
moves the line outside off, Green indicates that bounced more than he expected
comes forward and plays back to the bowler
uses his feet again but can't get to the pitch so just taps to midwicket
full outside off, left alone
full and straight, squeezed into midwicket, not too far from getting through...has been a good start to this spell from Thakur

good shot and good fielding, Paine comes forward and drives to the left of mid-off, Siraj does very well to intercept with a dive. Plenty of people will hold their breath when an India bowler dives at the moment
short of a length outside off, 132kph, left alone
gets onto the front foot to a half volley, a solid drive but straight to mid-off
pushed down the leg side, glances the pad through to Pant
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
flicked off the stumps to mid-on
flicked into short leg
fuller, pushed back down the pitch
aims to work this away but gets the outer part of the bat as the face closes
steps to leg and pushes a short-of-a-length delivery into the covers...some more sound effects from Pant behind the stumps
very nice stroke, whips a full delivery off the stumps wide of mid-on
full outside off, 136kph, left alone
good length at off stump, defended with a solid clunk off the bat
in the channel outside off, Green leaves it alone
wider outside off, Green not tempted into chasing it...has been some movement with the old ball
short and wide outside off, in another situation he may have had a go at that, but it's through to the keeper
over the wicket, angling down the leg side, padded away
flicked off the pads but straight into short leg
worked into midwicket
plays back to a straight delivery and defends
goes back again, opens the face and steers this through short third man
full, down the leg side, Paine sweeps from a standing position and sends it to fine leg. Not a great delivery
he's got an outside edge to a yorker, which then squirts to second slop having gone straight into the pitch
strides forward into a strong drive which finds mid-off

dropped! Thakur has spilled it himself. A full delivery which Green drove again, this is bunted back to the bowler at waist height. What a moment that could have been. Return catches aren't easy, but that should have been held
left alone
full at middle and off, defended and takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
tight leave! That's a Gabba leave. Basically traveled over off stump. Back of a length, carries through nicely
defended into midwicket
worked into the on side
fuller at middle and off, some drift there, pushed to mid-on
flicked to the on side
again he hits short leg as he flicks this firmly
short outside off, rocks back and square cuts in front of point
over the wicket, pushed across full outside off, left alone
well bowled, back of a length at middle and off, moves off the seam and beats the outside edge
length ball outside off, 128kph, shapes away and Green leaves alone
makes him play, back of a length at middle and leg, defended to midwicket
on middle, he's goes back and across, defends
fuller at off stump, Green drives straight and mid-off can't quite cut it off with a dive but takes the pace off it
good length outside off, left alone
on off stump, defended to mid-on
beaten! Short of a length outside off, Green has a fiddle at it as he moves across the crease...good carry to Pant
back of a length at off stump, 129kph, defended
gets across outside off as he defends a short delivery towards point
banged in short of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
flash and a miss! Short of a length, angled across, Paine aims a booming square cut
bang! Top shot from the captain. Short of a length outside, Paine latches on and drags a powerful pull through midwicket
good comeback! Gets it back full outside off, angling across, Paine pushes at it without much footwork and is beaten
length ball on the pads, nice piece of timing as it flicks it through square leg...they make it an all-run four
comes round the wicket, solidly defended
angled into leg stump, takes the thigh pad
136kph, left alone outside off
a big appeal for lbw but that looked pretty high...and there's no interest in the review
good length outside off, 138kph, getting it through nicely as Green leaves it alone
excellent delivery! Good stuff from Siraj...short of a length outside off, climbs past the edge as Green has a nervy poke
wider outside off, left alone
touch too wide, a comfortable one to leave, but that's now 1 run in 35 balls for Green
round the wicket, full outside off, left alone
width outside off, square cuts in front of point, doesn't quite have the legs for a boundary
he's able to break free this time, full outside off, strides forward and drives handsomely through the covers. Very good from Green after being under the pump
poor ball down the leg side, flicked away but straight to fine leg...the efforts of the day showing for Natarajan
short and wide, Paine square drives through point...a late burst of runs for this pair
fuller outside off, 131kph, left alone
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended...Siraj keeping his pace up well
angled into the pads, neatly timed through square leg...careful! For a moment they started for the third there before Green was sent back
good length outside off, he shuffles across and leaves alone
worked into midwicket
a bouncer over off stump, he sways out of the way
another bouncer, sails over Paine's back to bring an end to the day
over the wicket, full at middle, defended
angled across full outside off stump, 130kph, left alone
a beauty! Good length at middle and off, starts to come in then nips away off the seam. Skims past Green's edge. Too good
terrific response from Green. leans forward into a full delivery and nails the perfect straight drive back past the stumps
that's loose! A lively first over...Natarajan pushes this wider outside off, Green chases it well away from his body and nearly nicks it to Pant
another screaming drive...Green strides forward and meets this with a full face sending it straight of mid-off. A bit for everyone in that over, but ultimately eight runs off it
starts with a bouncer which angles down the leg side
works a back-of-a-length delivery into midwicket
short outside off, 135kph, Green comes across and nearly has a nibble at it but think just pulled his bat inside the line
fuller at off stump, 137kph, defended to mid-on
that's very short and keeps climbing, evades a diving Pant and that's a bonus four. In fact, called wides
full at off stump, he comes forward and drives again but this time can't beat mid-off
angled into the pads, tucked to fine leg...handy start for Australia
very wide outside off and moves away further, Green has a flash at it and is nowhere near making contact. He's overstepped
full at off stump, 132kph, defended to cover
short of a length, this hurries Paine a touch, takes the bottom hand off the bat as he works it around the corner
back of a length at middle, 132kph, defended
angled across outside off, left alone
full, wide, driven firmly but straight to cover...that was in the air for a while
a whip-drive this time, from around off stump, firmly back towards the bowler
back of a length at middle, touch of seam movement, Paine is a little squared up as he defends
full outside off, hint of shape away, left alone
on off stump, back of a length at 133kph, defended
nearly drags on! Some fortune there for Paine. Looking to force this away off the back foot, was cramped for room, takes an inside edge
full and wide, left alone
short of a length outside off, Paine steers it to point with an open face. Good over from Siraj
full on leg stump, some swing, takes the pad as Green aims to flick to leg
good delivery, back of a length at middle and off, Green leaves this on length rather than line as it shapes back
good follow up, full and wide outside off, Green chases it miles away from his body without any footwork. Nearly an edge
that's more controlled by Green, takes a stride forward and then shoulders arms
pushed across outside off, 131kph, through to the keeper
back of a length on middle, 128kph, defended to mid-off. Back-to-back maidens
full outside off, this shapes away nicely and keeps going as it reaches Pant
good length outside off, 135kph, this zips through to the keeper who takes it on the rise. Nice stuff
a bouncer, over middle and leg, Paine leaves the bat up as he ducks underneath
left alone outside off
touch fuller, angled into the pads, deflects towards square leg
short of a length at off stump, 137kph, defended down by his feet. That's Siraj's 10th maiden in 22 overs.
switches the line to round the wicket, wide outside off, left alone
fuller and closer to off stump but Paine is able to leave alone
full at off stump, tapped to the on side and they scamper the single
edged! Wide of second slip. Full outside off, tempts the drive, playing away from his body and it's between second slip and gully at catchable height
comes forward and drives again, gets a thick inside edge into his boot
that's nicely played, a confident stride into a full delivery, he ends up right across outside off, drives to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, 138kph, defended
that's a tight leave! Comes back sharply off the seam, not far from off stump as it bends into Paine. Well bowled
this one is left on length, almost carries over off stump

full at off stump, pushed to the bowler...then Siraj hurls the ball back at Paine who is outside of his ground! That would be have been very interesting with a hit. Paine was busy looking at the toe of his bat
tucked off the hip to deep square
a short ball which he ducks
poor delivery to start, full on the pads, flicked through midwicket with excellent timing
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, some shape away, left alone
full outside off, left alone
swings away full outside off, Paine shoulders arms
climbs through to Pant who takes it at chest height. Good comeback after that first delivery
that's nicely timed, a length ball angling in, pushed with a straight bat wide of mid-on
full outside off, Paine walks at this and defends to mid-on
well across outside off and defends a full delivery
tucks this off the stumps backward of square
short of a length outside off, forced into the on side
banged in short, he goes across and defends taking the bottom hand off the bat
good length outside off, nice channel, left alone
fuller at middle, worked into the leg side and mid-on can't stop the single
full on the pads, 137kph, clipped to long leg
straight, back of a length, defended to mid-on
very wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, tighter line, left alone
pushed down the leg side
worked off the pads to short midwicket
edged! Doesn't carry to slip as it rebounds off Pants leg. Length ball outside off, goes on with the arm, can't call that a chance for Pant and it drops in front of Rahane
worked into the leg side
full outside off, pushed into the covers and that takes Paine to his fifty from 102 balls. Vital innings from the captain
played into the off side
full outside off, 135kph, left alone
edged, taken at second slip! So it's fifty and out for Paine. Thakur rewarded. Full outside off, it's a big drive, the outside edge flies at chest height to Rohit who takes it nicely
short of a length and some shape away from the corridor, left alone
full and very wide outside off, reaches out for that and is beaten
short of a length, 133.4kph, in the corridor and climbing. Left alone
good length and into the stumps. Watchfully defended into the leg side
good length on leg stump, blocked on the front foot
full at middle and leg, driven down to long-on with the turn
full on off stump, jabbed to mid-off's right
full on leg stump, steps out and clips to short midwicket

plays the wrong line and is cleaned up! Green expected this length ball to turn into his stance down the leg side, but it's held its line slightly as he gets an angled bat down, trying to pat this towards mid-on. It's past his outside edge and hits middle and leg
full and just outside off, driven back to the bowler
full and a slight curve away in the corridor. Jammed into the covers
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep square
good length and wide outside off, left alone

that looks plumb as anything. Cummins reviews though, has he got bat on that? He's been struck on the full, above the boot flap, right in front of middle stump. He was looking to flick and was through it far too soon...and that is hitting leg stump. This is now officially a collapse for Australia, and a review goes alongside Cummins
short and cramped at the ribs, a hurried pull into vacant square leg
short of a length and just outside off, punched into the covers
good length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, pushed into the covers
sweeeet! Starc launches this over the long-on boundary with ease, and a lovely swing through the line. It's overpitched at off stump and he clears the front leg to nail this
oh, lovely shot. A nice swivel on this hook from Lyon. Cramped at the ribs again, but he's got the weight onto his back foot and pulled aerially to the backward square boundary
oh beauty! Four aesthetic runs with an on-drive he's beaming about. Full and at middle stump, only half a stride as he brings the full face down on this and gets it past the non-striker
short of a length at middle, defended off the back foot
lbw appeal is turned down. Good length and headed for middle stump. Strikes him on the thigh, and there was possibly an inside edge on it
beaten on the inside edge. Good length and jagging in off the seam outside off. Lyon was looking to punch through cover
short at middle stump, pulls into the ground and out to deep square
swiped past short fine! Good length and wide outside off, shuffles and gets down quickly on his back knee to execute the sweep to perfection
swept straight into Shaw's right knee at short leg. Another sweep from off stump, strikes him on the full
good length, turning and rising down leg and a sharp take from Pant above his hip
short of a length on middle stump, gets deep in the crease and flicks to deep backward square's left
yorker at middle stump, jammed into the leg side
good length at middle and leg, defended into the leg side
oh, neat. Good length and just outside off, stands tall and punches that between non-striker and mid-off off the back foot
short at off stump, pulled to deep square
short and very wide outside off, beaten on the cut
good length and just outside off, half a stride again and lovely punch on the rise to mid-off's right
short of a length at leg stump, dragged down to fine leg off the back foot
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, shuffles and sweeps out to deep square
full and just outside off, chops down on that for a thick outside edge fine of backward point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, defended on the back foot
full and angled into the pads, reaches out and flicks to midwicket's left
full on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
full on middle stump, driven against the angle to mid-on
Natarajan drags it in to his left at fine leg. A short ball that Starc top edges on the pull. It was bouncing away to the fieder's left and he's sprinted along the line before flapping it in
good length and down leg side, beaten on the flick
short and up at the throat, swivels and hooks to deep square's right
good length on off stump, defended towards mid-off
bouncer dug in too short, Starc drops his head into the leg side to let it go
full and down leg side, too wide for him to reach with a sweep
bowled him. Full and at middle and leg. He's shuffled once again to try and sweep, but this one is pushed deliberately fuller to beat the under-edge. Splits the stumps and that is Lyon's cameo done
good length and turning away outside off, far away from the bat
good length at the stumps, defended into the leg side
full on off stump, nicely driven with the turn to long-off
good length outside off, defended to cover on the front foot
good length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
good length outside off, punched to mid-off on the front foot
short and rising above off stump, arches back to let it go
short and across him again, left alone
full and just outisde off, steered through cover on the up
bouncer dug in too short, left alone
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, driven on the rise to short extra cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
full and into leg stump, flicked to short fine with the angle
good length and straightening in the corridor as he looks to stab through the covers. Beaten
bouncer dug in too short again, easily left alone
short and into middle stump, defended down the pitch

evades Mayank running to his left! Short of a length outside off, looks for the pull. Ends up slicing it and mid-on is back. So Agarwal has to run to his left from extra cover and leap full stretch for that. Agarkar points out on air that mid-on had no business being back for a predominantly short-pitched bowling strategy
full and into the stumps, clipped into the leg side
full at middle stump, punched to mid-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off with the turn
full on middle stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and angled into the corridor, left alone
full on off stump, driven firmly to short extra's left. He can't stop that cleanly, it trickles out to long-off
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and into leg stump, flicked to deep square
short and at a middle stump line. Backs away to try and ramp this over the slips, beaten
short and just outside off, left alone

punched to the cover boundary! This is short of a length and pushed just outside off. Lots of room for Hazlewood who is batting outside leg stump and gets his hands through a well-timed punch off the back foot
short at off stump, left alone
wow! Hazlewood in all his glory! A length ball wide outside off and he's just hit the most flowing, graceful drive on the rise. Rapidly through the vacant covers region
good length and wide outside off, left alone
length outside off, left alone
short of a length and turning away outside off, left alone
good length, spun away wide outside off as he leaves
good length at middle stump, defended off the outside half on the front foot
short of a length and turning away outside off, left alone
good length and into the pads. Hazlewood cops that on the thigh as he looks to glance

knocks out off stump with a full one! Simple as that. Driving length and straight on at an off stump line. Hazlewood has got his feet down leg side and is driving with a massive gap between bat and legs. Beaten on the inside edge
pushed across wide outside off, reaches Paine above head height from a reasonably full length
fuller, outside off at 142kph, significant carry again as Paine takes this on the rise at shoulder height
it's certainly going through nicely, this is just a little wide and easy for Rohit to leave well alone
full at off stump, 141kph, makes him play and it's solidly defended to mid-off
nicely played, confidently onto the front foot, pushes through the line of a full delivery through the covers
full, outside off, 143kph and left alone...a range-finding over for Starc
on off stump, full, defended
back of a length outside off, 134kph, defended to point
short of a length at off stump, defended to mid-on
full outside off, left alone, and this one reaches Paine at his bootlaces
this one climbs past the outside edge from short of a length, Gill pulls his bat away but think he was beaten
fuller, at off stump, Gill quite deep in the crease and takes his bottom hand off the bat as this hits the splice
short of a length outside off, 141kph, defended towards point
onto the back foot and steers a short delivery to the off side
fuller, outside off, 145kph and left alone
angled across, and keeps going straight, through to the keeper
that's a good one! Movement this time. Starts on middle and off, nips away off the seam and beats the edge
good length outside off, 143kph, left alone
angled into the pads, worked down to long leg
full at off stump, 137kph, defended to cover
defended on the front foot
tucked off the pads through square leg
short of a length at off stump, worked back down the pitch
full and straight, 137kph, driven back to the bowler
full on off stump, closes the face and squeezes it through midwicket
short outside off, Gill stands tall and square drives in front of point...terrific shot
gets this fuller but it's wide outside off, 143kph, left alone
good length, pitches just outside off and angles across, left alone
full at off stump, 145kph, defended to mid-off
defended on the back foot to the off side
good length at middle and off, 136kph, defended back down the pitch
almost turns the face of the bat a little early, this comes off the outer half
angled in at off stump on a good length, defended with soft hands
short, pushed down the leg side, Rohit chases it with a pull but doesn't make contact
full outside off, defended on the front foot to cover
nicely bowled, some indecision from Rohit to a good-length ball outside off, started playing then withdrew at the last moment
full outside off, 136kph, hint of shape away and left alone

edged, taken at slip! Cummins makes his mark straightaway. In that awkward length outside off, uncertain whether to play or leave, takes a thick edge and Smith snaffles it at second. What a bowler he is.
edged, just short this time! Oh boy. Cummins goes full outside off, draws Pujara onto the front foot, he does well not to push too hard. It reaches Smith on the half volley
back of a length, angled into the pad, deflects towards short leg
full outside off, 142kph, defended towards backward point
a shorter delivery on off stump, defended on the back foot. That's a brilliant over from Cummins
tucks a straight delivery into square leg...he overstepped as well
good length at off stump, defended
offers no shot to this one which nips in from outside off, glances the pad but nowhere near lbw
fuller outside off, comes onto the front foot and defends
a short delivery, gets inside the line and helps it round the corner with a pull between long leg and deep square
big appeal for lbw! Given not out. Late seam movement here, a good length ball, beats Rohit's edge and takes the back leg. Height always the issue, but it's not a million miles away
full at off stump, 141kph, dead-batted to the off side
very full outside off, pushed to mid-off
full at off stump, 142kph, defended
drives, thick outside edge, gets away with it...goes after a full delivery outside off, playing away from his body, not entirely in control but it runs wide of gully to third man
solidly behind the line and defends
good stride forward and pushes square to the off side
good length, in the channel, defended
back of a length at off stump, defended
outside off, left alone
short of a length, steered into the point region off the back foot to get Pujara off the mark
back of a length outside off, through to the keeper
played square into the off side from the back foot
fuller, he comes forward and defends
angled in at off stump, defended to mid-on
defended with bat and pad together, 143kph
a bouncer, Pujara ducks
good length outside off, steered wide of a diving gully
targeting the stumps this time, 145kph, worked into midwicket
good length at off stump, that may have been scrambled seam, defended off a thick inside edge
good length at middle and off, defended to the on side
full outside off, shaping away, left alone
this one nips in from a good length, beats the bat and takes the pad but sliding down
full at off stump, driven into the covers, skews in the air a little but very safe as mid-off gives chase
short of a length, 138kph, defended to the off side
back of a length, defended off the thicker outer part of the bat towards gully
full at off stump, eased straight of mid-off
and again, this time for Rohit, a full delivery at off stump is driven straight down the ground. Labuschagne chases hard and manages to flick it back
a short ball, angled down the leg side, zips through to Paine as Pujara gets inside the line
full and straight, 144kph, defended
good length at middle and off, defended towards mid-on
edged, short of second slip again! Draws him away from his body a fraction, pushed outside of his pad, but he gets away with it
short of a length at off stump, defended
short and wide, Rohit doesn't miss out, carves it through backward point with a powerful square drive
over corrects the line, into the pads, tucked to deep square leg
full outside off, left alone
angling into leg stump on a full length, dropped into the leg side
left alone outside off
full outside off, a nice-looking drive finds mid-off
length ball outside off, left alone
short outside off, defended on the back foot
goes for the pull this time, doesn't quite get hold of it towards mid-on
good leave, angling in at off stump
was there inside edge? This loops back down the pitch rather than to short leg. A delivery angling in from back of a length
starts on a wide line outside off, Rohit stretches forward and opens the face to angle the ball towards third man
uses his feet then kicks this back down the pitch
worked from outside off into midwicket
plays back and steers into space on the off side
full at off stump, turned to the on side
this one turns but is a fraction short, Rohit has time to place it off the back foot into the covers
edged, between the slips and the gully...feeling for it away from his body but gets the ball to ground
full at off stump, 144kph, defended
short of a length, dropped into the off side...speed gun pushed to 147kph
excellent stroke, full at off stump, a turn of the wrists sends this straight of mid-on. Lovely timing
a short delivery, gets into a bit of an awkward position but is able to pull to long leg
good length at off stump, 144kph, defended towards point
full at off stump, leans forward and defends
wider outside off, searching for a drive, left alone
comes down the pitch then pads the ball away, was wide outside off
straighter, worked off the stumps backward of square on the leg side
uses his feet then kicks it away
down the pitch and flicks a straight delivery to midwicket
full and just outside off, driven sweetly to short extra
good length and jagging away from the corridor, left alone
full at off stump, 141kph, solidly on the front foot to pat this to mid-on

gently punched past the bowler and once again it is too much for the fielder! Whew, classy stuff. Full and just outside off. Leans into his half stride and checks his punch. It's been timed perfectly and sprints between bowler and mid-off
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and into the corridor, solidly defended on the front foot
full at middle stump, steps out and flicks to square leg's right
length and turning in outside off, defended on the front foot
dropped short outside off, waits on that to turn into him and punches it through the vacant point region off the back foot
length and dipping outside off, reaches forward and pushes down the pitch with the turn

holes out to long-on! It's that dip from Nathan Lyon again, luring a batsman out of the crease and then beating him in flight. What a bowler. It's at a middle and leg stump line. Rohit steps out and is soon realising he won't get to the pitch of this. Reaches well in front of his body and sticks with the lofted shot on his mind, but all he can do is lob it up for the fielder running in and to his right. Pretty ordinary after he'd started to look good
length and turning into the pads, defended off the back foot
good length and just outside off, blocked on the front foot
good length and in the corridor, solidly defended on the front foot
good length and cutting away outside off, left alone
good length at leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length and at the stumps, defended from the crease
full and dipping in at off stump, watchfully defended on the front foot
good length and into middle stump, punched to mid-on off the back foot
length at off, defended off the back foot
short of a length at off, looks to stab that past silly point off the back foot, can't do it and has to scramble back into his crease
length outside off, steps out and kicks
length outside off, to the pitch and turns it to midwicket
good length and turning into the pads. Gets forward and cops that on the leg
good length and nipping away outside off, left alone
full and into off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and just outside off, punched to point on the rise
good bouncer. That is mean, rising from a length, not very short, but at the throat at an off stump line. Decent technique as he drops the hands and sways to let it go
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length outside off and patted into the off side
length at leg stump, steps out and nudges to square leg
good length and loopy outside off, steps out and bat-pads down the pitch
good length and ripping in at off stump, backs away and hurriedly jabs into the off side
good length at off stump, steps out and again and isn't to the pitch. Wears that on the leg
short of a length, turning into middle stump. Whipped to midwicket off the back foot
good length and into the pads, defended off the back foot
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short and just outside off. Shaped to pull but seemed to stop and ended up patting it into the off side. That stuck in the pitch
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
short and just outside off, looks for the pull and that's onto him quickly. Under-edge into the vacant leg side to get off the mark
full and into middle stump, defended into the leg side
short of a length at off stump, pushed back down the pitch off the back foot
length at off stump, steps out and flicks towards deep mid-on
good length outside off, steps out and offers the pad
length outside off, steps out and kicks to silly point
length on middle, gets deep in the crease and turns it to short fine off the back foot
short and turning down leg side, left alone
starts on off stump, as he so often does, defended to the on side
tight to off stump, 138kph, reasonably full and defended
touch fuller, Rahane comes forward into a confident push through the off side which gives mid-off a chase
angled in at the stumps, full length, defended to the on side
a little wider outside off, left alone...nice carry to Paine
full at off stump, 139kph, defended into the covers
short of a length, in at middle and leg, defended towards short leg
good length at middle and off, defended to mid-on
goes quite wide on the crease, it's short of a length and defended on his toes
fuller, outside off, left alone
good length outside off, comes in with the angle from round the wicket but Pujara is able to leave
full at off stump, 143kph, defended with bat and pad together
defended on the front foot to the covers
a shorter delivery, at the body, Rahane swivels on a pull to deep square leg
well bowled, extra lift from a good length outside off, a well-judged leave
at off stump, just back of a length, defended with those trademark soft hands
shorter, angled in at the hip, flicked past short leg
short of a length at middle and off, defended down into the leg side
over the wicket now, full and wide outside off, left alone
edged, flies wide of gully! Starc gets him to reach for one, nowhere in control, the thick edge just evades the long reach of a diving Green
back to a far more controlled leave to a very similar delivery
angled across, full outside off at 140kph, left alone
pushed wider outside off
angled across, nothing come back yet, left alone
a short delivery, defended on the back foot with the bottom hand coming off the bat
good length outside off, left alone
right on the spot, good length angling in at off stump, Pujara comes half forward and defends with a slightly open face
full at off stump, 142kph, defended
just back of a length, angling in towards off stump, left on length as much as line
short of a length outside off, through to the keeper. Good contest
edged, through the slips again! It's going Rahane's way so far...full outside off, pushing with hard hands, scoots between third slip and gully and perfect catching height
full at off stump, gets a good stride forward and a defensive push runs straight of mid-off
round the wicket, short outside off, a superb back-foot square drive finds the deep point fence
angled into the body, back of a length, worked into midwicket
on off stump, short of a length, defended
short from round the wicket, pushed down the leg side, Pujara just watches it go through
full at middle and off, sweetly pushed to mid-on
short of a length outside off, stays back and defends to the off side
fuller outside off, raises the bat high out of the way
very short outside off and it keeps climbing, so much so that Paine can't reach it with a leap
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
a touch uncertain as he defends, takes a thick inside edge to the on side
round the wicket, full at the stumps, worked into midwicket
short of a length outside off, 141kph, left alone...it hasn't really swung for Starc
goes after a short one, did very well to get this wide of gully, rode the bounce and square cut it down to wide third man. Very nicely played
tucked off the pads wide of leg slip down to fine leg
over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, defended
full at the stumps, some nice whippage from Rahane and he sends it well in front of square
short of a length, takes his bottom hand off the bat to keep this down in front of short leg
pushes a short-of-a-length delivery towards point, well-judged single
top shot! That made a lovely sound off the bat. Stands tall and punches off the back foot through the covers...doesn't quite reach the rope
nips back from short of a length, takes him high on the pad
full outside off, defended
a short one outside off, almost evades Paine again but he manages to get a glove on it to prevent another set of four byes
over the wicket, full outside off, this one doesn't quite reach Paine on the full
full outside off, he's reaching for this drive a little, away from his body, but connects nicely, mid-off is able to intercept
full at middle and off, 141kph, defended to mid-off
pushed across full outside off, left alone
shorter outside off, cut towards point, Starc immediately turns and looks at the bowling crease
full at off stump, solidly pushed straight of mid-off, a long chase down the ground for Wade
starts with a beauty! Full at off stump, nibbles off the seam to beat the outside edge
this time gets a slightly bigger stride into the ball, defends to the off side
a shorter delivery, tapped square into the off side
full at off stump, 137kph, defended back to the bowler
good length, touch wider outside off, he's forward and defends to point
gets onto the front foot again, pushes into the covers
comes down the pitch straightaway, flicks into the on side
taken from outside off behind square on the leg side
short of a length, played to the on side
wide line outside off, Rahane uses his feet and plays square into the off side
short outside off, he rocks back and square drives to the point fence. Nice footwork
straighter delivery, defended towards cover
loops safe! Got into a tangle against the short ball. Angling in at Pujara who tries to sway out of the line, can't get the bat and gloves out of the line. Doesn't carry to gully
good follow-up, fuller outside off, plays with an open face towards the slips
good length outside off, 139kph, defended
short outside off, left well alone

edged, gone! Hazlewood does it. That's a cracker, in the channel at off stump, the ball that has done for Pujara a few times this series. Angles in at off stump then straightens a fraction. Not much he could have done. Huge moment
back of a length, angling in, defended to the on side
plays back and pushes to the on side
worked off the pads to backward square
touch short, defends on the back foot
wider outside off, more nicely placement from Rahane as he square drives through point
hint of turn from outside off but he's able to defend on the back foot
this is fuller, Agarwal gets right across his crease as he stretches forward to defend
short of a length, nips back and takes the thigh pad
a beauty! He's in the groove this morning. Good length just outside off, climbs past the outside edge as Rahane presses forward
gets a good stride into the ball, defends to the off side
a short delivery, rolls his wrists and pulls well in front of square
good length outside off, 137kph, left alone
full outside off, defended
some turn there, defended to silly point
dragged down short, rocks back and pulls to deep square
uses his feet and works to the on side
full outside off, whipped towards mid-on who is reasonably deep
good shot, a very full delivery outside off, driven through the off side...big chase from Green who flicks it back. Super work. But they've rum four anyway
slides on outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, 136kph, pushed off the back foot to cover
length ball outside off, defended
short of a length outside off, across the crease and defends
fuller, shapes in at the stumps, neatly turned off the pads through midwicket
short outside off, he drops the bat and sways out of the way
full at the stumps, closes the face and nearly gets a leading edge to cover
fullish in the corridor, left alone
length ball, wider outside off, leaves it again
length ball, fifth-stump line, Agarwal leaves once more
fuller now, and Agarwal gets a stride forward to block it back towards the bowler
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
back of a length, a little closer to off stump, leaves again, ensuring he doesn't leave the bat or gloves in the way
fullish, angling into off stump, clipped watchfully to mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle stump, defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, left alone

ooh, that's a tight leave. Length ball, angling in from slightly wider of the crease, and he gets a good stride forward before letting go. Not too far outside off, maybe he left it on length, trusting the bounce
short on off stump, gets up to just below chest height, pulled round to the left of long leg
fullish, angling into off stump, lets it come and defends towards short extra-cover, meeting the ball right under his eyes
shortish, close to off stump, hops to ride the bounce and jab into the point region
low full-toss angling into the stumps, shows it the full face and punches between umpire and non-striker. Didn't go too hard at it, because it was dipping awkwardly as it reached him
fullish in the corridor, left alone
full on off stump, and Rahane doesn't get a stride forward while punching to mid-off. The ball briefly hung in the air there
length ball, goes wider outside off here, left alone
