length ball outside off, left alone
ooh, plays away from his body there. Quite full, but not exactly a drive ball outside off. Gets a good stride forward, though, head low towards the ball, and punches to the left of extra-cover

the Cummins stock ball. Just slightly back of a length, angling into the corridor and straightening away with steep bounce. Agarwal goes back and across to defend, doesn't get his bat anywhere near it
length ball outside off, left alone
length ball, a bit wider outside off, left alone
full, close to off stump, good stride forward to drive to the left of extra-cover
length ball angling into off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball on off and middle, gets on the back foot to defend into the off side
full, close to off stump, nearly a yorker. Jabbed firmly towards mid-off
back of a length angling into the thigh pad, tucked into the square leg region
fullish, fairly close to off stump, gets forward and punches with an open face, forcing the point fielder to dive left to stop the ball
in the blockhole on off stump, jabbed towards point
length ball outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length on off stump, hops to ride the bounce and block towards mid-off
good bouncer, angling into off stump and climbing steeply at Agarwal, who ducks down low to get under it
another bouncer, angled a little further inwards this time, ducks once more, dropping down low with his head to the off side of the ball

big appeal for caught behind, and a review too. Shortish, this one's angling in towards Agarwal's hip as he hops to ride the bounce and glance it fine. Paine and Cummins go up immediately, but Paul Wilson isn't interested. Great decision - that came off the thigh, no bat at all
back of a length close to off stump, hops across to defend towards point with an open face
fullish, angling into the pads, tucked quietly into the backward square leg region
full, angling in close to off stump, good stride forward to drive, firmly and into the ground. Short extra-cover jumps up and stops it with his palm raised high above him
now Green bounces Agarwal, and he ducks to let it pass over him, on an off-stumpish line
full, angling in from wide of the crease and finishing just outside off. Uses his wrists to clip it straight of mid-on
length ball angling into off stump, clipped towards midwicket
full, angling into off stump, punched towards mid-off
back of a length close to off stump. Jumps to ride the bounce and defend, and the ball hits the inside half of his bat, high up, and rolls away behind square on the leg side
back of a length on off stump, blocked back to the bowler. Got nicely behind the line there

loose. Full, angling in from wide of the crease, but it's not quite pitched right up for the drive. And Agarwal is a little late getting forward - in fact there's barely any stride - and he only manages a thick edge that flies away between second slip and gully
length ball on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball close to off stump, may have left that on length, because it was angling in and didn't finish too far outside off
length ball outside off, some outswing but it's mostly after the batsman leaves it, just before reaching the keeper
half-volley angling into the stumps, clipped to deep backward square leg
back of a length on off stump, nicely back and across to defend into the on side
short, angling down leg, plays a controlled pull down to long leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and plays a checked punch into the covers
full, slanting away from off stump, left alone
full, maybe the merest hint of shape in towards the stumps. Keeps his front pad out of the way and blocks to mid-off
length ball slanting across, finishing fairly close to off stump. Good leave
and again, on the fuller side of a length and slanting across to finish in the corridor. Leaves it again

good bouncer, rising steeply over leg stump. Agarwal does well to sway out of the line here, keeping his eyes on the ball right through. Good sign that he swayed here, with his upper body going towards the leg side, because he's ducked in the other direction when Cummins bounced him from the opposite angle
put away. Back of a length, a touch too straight, and that's glanced away fine with no fuss
back of a length, spinning in towards off stump, worked with the spin to long-on
flat, a bit of extra bounce as it spins into Agarwal's hip, clipped to backward square leg
tossed up on middle stump, gets a good stride out to clip to midwicket
slightly quicker length ball on a stump-to-stump line, clipped off the front foot to midwicket
shot. Marginally short, and he rocks back and across to pull to deep square leg
length ball, middle-and-leg line, goes back to defend into the on side
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
length ball, again Agarwal can trust the bounce and leave it even if it doesn't finish too far outside off. No swing for Starc so far in this spell
length ball, slanting away from off, left alone
full, strays onto a middle-and-leg line, clipped gently square of midwicket
back of a length, slanting away from off stump, left alone

gone, this was coming. Rahane got away with a couple of these in the first session, but now he doesn't. Not full enough to drive, slanting into a wide line outside off, and he goes hard at it, well away from his body, and gets a thick edge once again. This time, though, Starc has a fourth slip in place, and he catches it at just above chest height. Not the wisest of shots from Rahane especially with the slips cordon strengthened
flat, spinning in towards off stump, goes on the back foot to defend
tossed up wide of off, big stretch forward to drive to the left of mid-off
down the track first ball, drives the full one back to the bowler
quicker length ball outside off, left alone
nicely flighted on off stump, gets a stride forward to block it back to the bowler, keeping his front pad away from the line
fuller now, on off stump, gets forward to defend it back down the pitch
back of a length, slanting into a wide line outside off, left alone
length ball close to off stump, slanting across, left alone
back of a length on middle stump, hops to ride the bounce and tuck it away to long leg
full, slanting across into the fifth-stump channel, inviting the drive. Left alone
length ball close to off stump, good leave, trusting the angle and the bounce
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone. May have been some sort of cutter, because it didn't carry to Paine on the full
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come and punches to the right of cover point

bam. Agarwal and Rohit are similar batsmen in that they love hitting sixes off spinners. Sees a bit of flight from Lyon and he jumps out and launches him over the long-on boundary. Wasn't fully to the pitch, but he was in a good position with relation to the ball
quicker, goes back and tucks it off the hip to square leg
flat, angling across to off stump, goes back and clips to short leg
length ball on leg stump, hurried into a defensive block to short leg
tossed up slower, angling across to off stump, big stretch out to get right up to the pitch of the ball and defend
shortish, rising to Pant's front shoulder, fends awkwardly at it with bottom hand off the handle but manages to keep it down in a fairly controlled manner into the on side
fullish, slanting into a wide line outside off, left alone
full on middle and leg, keeps his front pad out of the way and brings his bat down straight to punch it back past the bowler's left hand. Nicely timed
nicely left, back of a length and bouncing over off stump, but he can definitely trust the bounce here
full outside off, punched firmly to short cover
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
quickish length ball outside off, left alone
tossed up slower on off stump, gets forward to defend into the cover point region
nice length on off stump, good stride forward to block it back to Lyon
drops short now and Pant rocks back to cut to the right of backward point. A bit of extra bounce there, and the ball was briefly in the air, but always in the gap
quick length ball on off stump, blocked back to Lyon
quick again, angling into leg stump, gets forward and blocks it into the pitch to bring the session to a close
good start, at off stump, 131kph, defended

edged, taken at the second attempt! That was a very poor shot. A wild, booming drive, hadn't given himself a chance to get in again. Wasn't full enough for the drive, was actually a short-of-a-length delivery outside off, he threw his hands at it. The catch went quickly above head height to Smith. It didn't go in cleanly, but he held the rebound
gets a bouncer first up, outside leg stump and he gets underneath it
full at the stumps, pushed into midwicket to get his first Test runs
round the wicket, back of a length and angling in, pushed out to deep point
fended short of fourth slip! Another short ball, didn't play this one very well, tried to drop his hands and it glances off his chest
round the wicket, good length, pushed to the off side
full at off stump, worked towards mid-on
stays round the wicket, at off stump, defended
full at off stump, forces himself onto the front foot and plays to cover
good bouncer, this follows Sundar from round the wicket, but he sways out of the line nicely
not far from short leg! A short delivery into the body, fended off his hip backward of square
terrific shot! Full at off stump, gets nicely forward and eases it straight of mid-off
drags the length back, defended to the off side
a short ball over off stump, he drops his hands
round the wicket, length ball outside off, left alone
a short ball angled down the leg side...Marnus heard something but that was miles from anything
good length at off stump, 138kph, defended. Sundar shaping up pretty well
nicely played, short of a length outside off, a punchy back foot drive with an open face...there's cover at deep point
full at off stump from round the wicket, 138kph, defended
defends a length ball into the off side
takes advantage of a full one outside off, strides forward and drives through the covers...deep point is able to get there
and now Sundar drives, but straight to mid-off who is very close
short outside off, fends at it somewhat but is able to keep it down in front of fourth slip
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, defended
a shorter delivery, rolls his wrists on a well-controlled pull in front of square but without much power
short outside off, left alone
wider outside off, through to the keeper
back of a length angling in at off stump, defended towards point
a very short ball, sails well over Sundar's head
over the wicket, back of a length outside off, back cuts this wide of gully down to third man...good attempt on the rope by Lyon. He got there, but the ball rolled off his body into the boundary
left alone outside off
good length at off stump, defended to mid-off
great shot...very full at off stump, Pant drives it perfectly straight down the ground. Good little counterpunch by Pant
gets away with this! Goes after a short ball, top edges the pull and it loops over short leg and lands in the vacant square-leg area
a straight bouncer, he sways out of the line
comes forward and drives nicely again, through the covers, more work for deep point
back of a length outside off, defended
taken, super catch! Green in the gully. Short outside off, Pant leans back and tries to send this over the slips. It went very quickly but Green adds another good grab to his list
good length angling in at off stump, defended to point
big appeal for lbw! Is it sliding down leg? Paul Wilson thinks so, it deflects away into the leg side. Australia don't review. Hit the outside of the pad
short of a length, behind the line and defends down by his feet
takes on the short ball! And connects very well. Hooked from around leg stump, didn't try to keep it down, it's well wide of fine leg
neatly played, punches a short-of-a-length delivery off the back foot through the covers
short and quick! Thakur nearly ends up on his backside as he gets out of the line of this bouncer
shot! He's nailed that. Full at off stump, Thakur plays a stand-and-deliver drive that beats mid-off
short of a length, defended down in front of short leg
nearly finds short leg, pops a short delivery off the splice
round the wicket, short outside off, drops his hands
nearly gets through the fuller one, gets a thick inside edge into his pads
back of a length outside off, plays this as though it doesn't quite get up, squirts off a thick edge into the ground and through the slips
short over leg stump, he ducks
booming drive! Chases this one on the up outside off and doesn't make contact
short of a length at off stump, defended to the on side
outside off, touch shorter, beats the edge as Thakur cuts
full outside off, comes forward and drives to cover
plays back and defends
wider outside off, leaves alone this time
moves right across outside off then lets it go
straighter, touch quicker on off stump, defended
edged, through the gap! Short of a length outside off, Sundar flashes at it off the back foot, the edge flies straight where third slip would have been
driven off the back foot into the covers
left alone outside off
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
that's a good-looking drive, get onto the front foot, finds cover
length ball at off stump, defended to the covers
this one grips, worked around the corner
nicely bowled, tossed up and then this goes on with the arm, beats the edge
knocked down off the pads in front of short leg
fuller outside off, onto the front foot and defends
finds the edge, but he keeps it down. Smith dives and cuts it off at slip
onto the front foot and defends. Nice over from Lyon
full outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, this runs off an open face wide of gully
angled into the pads and very nicely flicked away backward of square, some elegance in that stroke
that's even better! Full at off stump and that's an off-drive that anyone in the top order would be proud of
short of a length at middle and off, 146kph, defended
pushes this down the leg side, Sundar can't catch up with it
tossed up at off stump, pushed back to Lyon
comes down the pitch then defends with bat and pad together
played off the back foot to mid-off
forward and defends
goes back again, this one skids through and nearly beats him but he pushes to cover
slightly shorter, defended on the back foot
short, angling away from off stump, left alone
bouncer over leg stump, crouches down low to get under it
short, angling across to off stump, hops to ride the bounce and defend into the point region
shortish, at the hip, rides the bounce and works it past the left hand of the short leg fielder

bangs it in short, slanting across, and he gets off his feet and attempts the uppercut. Doesn't get all of it, and Green turns around at gully and races back towards the point boundary to try and get to the ball before it lands. Desperate dive, but he can't get his hands to it
shortish at the hip, hops and defends into the leg side
tossed up, angling into the stumps, steps out and drives firmly back to the bowler
tossed up slower on off stump, stretches out to block into the off side
back of a length on off stump, steps back and punches into the cover point region
tossed up on leg stump, keeps his front pad out of the way and blocks it back to the bowler
nice shot, though he doesn't time it as well as he'd like. Pitched right up on off stump, and he uses his wrists to whip against the turn, wide of mid-on. Doesn't get the power he wants, though
back of a length on off stump, gets on the back foot and blocks it down into the pitch
shot. Full on the pads, and that's clipped away elegantly through square leg. Nearly runs all the way to the boundary, but this is a slow outfield
shortish, at the hip, whipped away to long leg
bouncer, rises too steeply to trouble Washington, who ducks low and watches Paine leap to collect it over his head
back of a length, angling across the stumps. Punched back to the bowler
back of a length on leg stump, and he shows it the full face to push through the vacant mid-on region
bangs it in short, Thakur keeps his eye on the ball and ducks under
tossed up on off stump, big stretch out to defend towards mid-on
nicely flighted, dips onto a better length than the previous ball, which may have been a touch too full. Gets forward and blocks into the covers
again an excellent length on off stump, this one is quicker and skids through with the angle. Presses forward to defend, off the inside half of the bat into the leg side
a touch shorter, but lack of turn prevents him from getting the room he wants to cut. Chopped towards short extra-cover
nicely flighted outside off, gets forward and stays slightly leg-side of the ball to push to short extra-cover
flight and dip outside off, big stretch forward again to get close to the pitch and defend
very full on the stumps, punched back to the bowler
short, and he goes on the back foot to maybe punch into the covers, but extra bounce and turn and he chops to backward point
there's that extra turn and bounce again. Goes back and taps it down to point once more
fuller, just outside off, gets on the front foot and blocks into the covers
dangled up slow and wide of off, reaches out and drives to mid-off, losing his bottom hand in the process
flat length ball on off stump, goes back to defend to short cover
nicely flighted on middle and off, defended back to the bowler, ensuring his front pad is out of the way
a touch shorter, goes on the back foot and punches to short extra-cover. May have wanted to play it squarer initially
back of a length on off stump, makes room and cuts to point
tossed up outside off, stretches out and drives to the right of mid-off
flat length ball on off stump, goes back and blocks it down into the pitch
flat again, outside off, goes on the back foot to defend into the off side
short to start, at the body, jumps to ride the bounce and defend towards midwicket
extra bounce from a length. Sundar was looking to work that into the leg side, and it hits the sticker of his bat as he plays it down to short leg
back of a length, slanting away from off stump. Punched firmly, to the left of short extra-cover/wide mid-off, and the fielder dives and gets his hand to the ball but doesn't stop it completely
full on leg stump, clipped neatly and Starc dives to his right at midwicket/wide mid-on to stop it
length ball angling into middle stump, defended towards mid-on
bouncer, angling in over off stump. Drops down on his knees while swaying his upper body away from the line, keeping his eye on the ball all the way through. Excellent technique
back of a length outside off, left alone. Bounces a second time before it reaches Paine. May have hit a crack and lost a lot of pace
a bit fuller, fifth-stump line, gets on the front foot and leaves it alone
wow. That's full, almost driving length, and Thakur is a little slow getting on the front foot to drive through mid-off. It hits the seam and straightens exaggeratedly to beat the bat
back of a length, angling too straight, easily glanced off the thigh pad to the fine leg boundary

wow, he's getting the new ball to do a lot off the surface. Back of a length in the corridor, and this one jags back in like an offbreak. Thakur looks to hurriedly bring his bat down in defence, and gets an inside edge on it, and it flies past Paine too quickly even as he throws himself to his left. Juuust out of his reach. Definitely hit a crack
back of a length on off stump, defended into the on side
goes wide of the crease to angle a length ball in towards off stump. Stays back and defends with soft hands towards gully
back of a length outside off, and Washington uses that hint of width very well, opens his bat face to steer it to the left of gully. That brings up the fifty partnership too
short, angling down leg, looks to whip it away off the hip but can't connect
length ball angling into off stump, lets it come and defends back to the bowler
shortish close to off stump, rides the bounce and defends with soft hands into the point region
fullish, angling into off stump, gets on the front foot to play a checked drive to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, nipping in slightly towards middle stump, defended off the back foot into the on side
fullish, angling into off stump, clipped towards wide mid-on
bouncer, angling down leg, Thakur ducks and evades it
length ball angling into off stump, defended to that fielder at wide mid-on. Not much of a stride forward, just gets his head over the ball and plays slightly around his front leg

big appeal for lbw as this nips back in and catches Thakur on the crease while defending. Bruce Oxenford isn't interested, and Australia decide not to refer after having a think about it. Gets half-forward and gets a thin inside edge on it
swings and misses. Fullish, outside off, a hint of away swing, and Thakur goes for an airy drive on the up and misses
length ball slanting across to the top of off stump. Defends without really moving his feet, and the ball rolls towards gully off the outside half of the bat
full on off stump, good stride forward to punch towards mid-off

ooh, beauty. Length ball, slanting across and finishing close enough to off stump to force Washington to play. Gets half-forward to drive through mid-off, and the ball seams away and beats his outside edge
back of a length close to off stump, punched towards point

ooh, that's an awkward short ball. Doesn't get up as high as Sundar thinks it will, and it also keeps coming back into him against the angle. Somehow drops to his knees and sways far enough away from the line to evade it
length ball slanting across to off stump, defended with an open face into the point region
length ball angling into off stump, good stride forward to defend towards point
shortish, angling into the hip, tucked away to long leg. Oh, that bounced a lot more than I thought on first glance. It's hit his glove
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone
full on leg stump, clipped away through square leg
back of a length, angling into the stumps, gets nicely behind it to defend to midwicket
fullish outside off, gets forward and pushes gently to the left of extra-cover/wide mid-off
full, angling into middle stump, and Thakur leans forward to clip to the left of mid-on. Nicely played, keeping it down with that turn of his wrists

back of a length, seams away after pitching close to off stump. Rides the bounce to defend, manages to play with soft enough hands for the thick outside edge to run away along the floor between gully and backward point. That brings up India's 250
fullish, wide of off, left alone
bouncer angling down leg, ducks safely out of the way
length ball outside off, steep bounce through to Paine, who catches it over his head, but it's harmless because Thakur leaves it alone
fullish, angling into middle stump, blocked towards short leg
round the wicket, left alone outside off
driven into the covers where there's a diving save by Labuschagne
defended into point
full at middle and off, comes forward
defended off a thickish inside edge to the leg side
comes forward and gets an inside edge into his front pad
super shot, straight onto the front foot to a half volley outside off and it's driven through mid-off
full, wide outside off, left alone
up and over! Short outside off, Thakur doesn't even try to keep this down, gets underneath it and lofts the square cut over point
good length outside off, 144kph, left alone
good length and middle and off, this squats a little but he's able to adjust and keep it out
full outside off, square drives to point
full at middle, good stride forward as he defends
well played, rocks back to a shorter delivery and drives off the back foot but can't quite beat mid-off
pushed off the back foot
full at off stump, defended
goes back to this one, pushes to the off side
fuller, defended on the front foot. Solid.
full at off stump, driven confidently but straight to Starc
short of a length, defended to the on side
fuller at middle and leg, met with a straight bat and pushes down the ground
that's a good one, bit of extra bounce outside off and it climbs past the edge. Thakur had a nibble at it
full outside off, throws his hands into a drive with feet stuck in the crease, takes a toe end back to Starc
cracked away! One of the shots of the match. Unleashes a cover drive on the up. Wonderful stuff from Thakur
steps back and cuts this away from around off stump into the point region
gets an outside edge to one that goes straight on and bounces a touch more...another blow on that sore finger
short enough for him to defend on the back foot
stretches forward and defends
short of a length, driven off the back foot to cover
tossed up outside off, he leans forward and defends. Keeping himself controlled
and there's the bouncer, over middle and leg, ducks underneath
short of a length but he can play this, on his toes and defending towards point
edged, but this escapes through gully...a short-of-a-length delivery, Sundar gets squared up but the outside edge didn't carry to Green
another bouncer, 144kph, Sundar sways nicely out of the line
brings a loose drive this time, fuller outside off, Sundar's weight is back as he drives on the up...nearly nicked it
short outside off, sharp at 147kph, Sunder just gets his bat inside the line, the ball keeps rising to Paine who can't take it cleanly
full at the stumps, blocked
stretches forward and defends
full at off stump, pushed into the off side
this one grips, he gets into a bit of a tangle but defends it in the end
comes forward and gets an inside edge as he defends, runs backward of square
round the wicket, tossed up and off stump, nicely driven but finds cover
short, down the leg side, Thakur has a waft at it
a bouncer, 142kph, he ducks
short on leg stump, Thakur tries to get inside the line and is taken on the back side...and because it's evasive action India get four leg byes
back of a length, straight, solidly behind the line and pushes towards mid-off who is wide enough to allow the scampered single. Keen to get off strike
short of a length, down the leg side, Sundar moves across and misses his flick
back of a length outside off 149kph, defended towards point...that might be Starc's quickest ball of the match
there's the big shot! Brings up his fifty with a six over long-on...skips down the pitch, fully committed to the shot and that's a long way back. Fantastic innings
full at off stump, defended
dragged down short, pulled to deep square, he had to be careful not to go back into his stumps
square drives and finds cover
wonderful shot...big stride forward and plays the perfect cover drive, threads the off-side gap with precision. Very classy and brings up the century stand
this one slides in with the arm, tapped into the off side
neatly tucked off the hip to fine leg...no butts about that one
short on leg stump, 144kph, travels over the shoulder to Paine
full at the stumps, pushes to mid-off and sets off straightaway...that's his fifty as well, a brilliant innings from the debutant
pushed straight of mid-off
short and straight, Sundar stands to play this and is taken on the body
short outside off, 145kph, allows it through
defended from off stump, slides off the face
short and pulled to deep backward square, he would have wanted more than a single for that
round the wicket, full at middle, defended
even fuller, whipped wide of mid-on but not cleanly timed
short of a length, eases onto the back foot and pushes to long-on
gets away with this, aims a lofted drive inside out over cover, skews off a thicker outer half of the bat but lands safely
good length at off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, left alone
in the channel outside off, a well-judged leave
fuller at off stump, brings him forward and it slides off the face through backward point
goes after the short one! Was around leg stump, he swung through a hook shot and it flies off a top edge very fine
angled into the pads, deflects off the thigh guard behind square
round the wicket, full at the stumps, defended
defended from a middle and leg line
pushed across to off stump, he leans forward
on the pads, tapped down by his feet
over the wicket, turns into the pad and trickles behind square
over the wicket, full, driven back to the bowler...it's flat for Australia
back of a length at off stump, defended off the splice towards point
full outside off, drives handsomely but straight to mid-off
gets inside a short delivery and helps it through square leg
full outside off, left alone
short on leg stump, worked off the hip with one foot off the ground
fuller at the stumps, pushes this in the air towards the on side but it lands safety
round the wicket, outside off, left alone
slides on outside off, left alone
very full at middle and leg, jabbed back down the pitch
strides forward and drives to short cover
drives again and again picks out the short cover
this is a little shorter, played off the back foot into the covers
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended
goes after the short one again, swats a pull shot in the air but in front of square and safe

the breakthrough! Cummins gets it. Superbly bowled, good length just outside off stump, this nips back significantly and beats the big drive to end a fantastic innings and partnership. Terrific delivery, actually.
good length at the stumps, manages to defend this somewhat unconvincingly

a bouncer over off stump, left alone...Cummins is appealing and Australia have reviewed! Cummins and Wade are sure they heard a sound. Erm, well, think less said about that the better. There is a whole zip code between the ball, bat and glove
short of a length outside off, trying to withdraw the bat but ends up glancing towards third slip
short outside off, square drives to deep cover and doesn't run
wide outside off, driven powerfully straight cover...looks like Sundar will try to change gear
left alone outside off
full outside off, he doesn't play
goes down early and tries to paddle-sweep this from well outside off, gets a top edge into his helmet
it's a no-look six! Goes down on his back knee and slog-sweeps this, but with an almost straight bat, over deep midwicket. Extraordinary shot. We've seen those from Andre Fletcher in the BBL

lucky runs for Saini, as he ducks into a bouncer from Cummins without really keeping his eye on it. His hands go up as a reflex act of self-protection, and the ball hits the shoulder of his bat and loops up over gully
another quick bouncer over off stump, and Saini falls away from the line - literally - to avoid it
short, rising ball in the corridor, does well to leave it without leaving his bat or gloves in the way
somehow gets out of the way of another sharp bouncer. He was stepping away to the leg side but also trying to jab at the ball, and he's lucky not to have got any glove on it
length ball outside off, left alone
safely negotiates the last ball, ducks down low to get under another bouncer, this time it's angling in over leg stump
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
bouncer over middle stump, ducks hurriedly to get under it
good ball, rising steeply over off stump, and Sundar stands up tall, lets it come on, and defends with soft hands towards the cordon
length ball on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, makes a bit of room to try and punch it through cover point, but the fielder at short cover dives to his right and stops it
bouncer, slanting across Sundar. He thinks about leaning back and ramping it over the slips, but pulls out of the stroke because it's bounced too high

short, angling into the body and bouncing just above waist-high over leg stump. Saini was trying to back away and finds the ball following him. Jams his bat down and manages to squeeze it down to third man
back of a length, slanting across to off stump. Looks to punch down the ground without really moving his feet, and it straightens and hits inside edge, then onto thigh pad
back of a length on off stump, lets it come to him this time and punches to mid-off

lucky. Banged in short, and Sundar was trying to sway away from the line, but the ball didn't get up as high as he expected and hit him on the left shoulder. Then it bounces onto the pitch and rolls backwards, and doesn't miss off stump by much, but Washington looks so nonchalant as if nothing happened
another bouncer, this time gets up steeply over the stumps and Washington ducks under it
shortish at the hip, looks to tuck it away and the ball lobs briefly in the air towards leg gully, but doesn't get to the fielder. Not sure if there was any bat on it, or just thigh pad
bouncer, rising high over off stump, ducks under it while mostly keeping his eyes on the ball
length ball close to off stump, blocked ceremoniously to short extra-cover, front foot in position long before the ball had arrived
shortish on off stump, hops up to ride the bounce and plays it close to his body, if in ungainly fashion, to ensure the ball stays down on its way to gully

gone, Hazlewood's got his man. Again that short, rising ball that isn't quite a bouncer. No option of ducking or swaying here, the ball kept following him even as he tried to stay leg-side of the ball, and climbed towards the shoulder of his bat to find the edge to second slip

wow. Assumed correctly that he'd get a short one first up, and it was a similar ball to the one that got Saini, ut Siraj has stepped away to the leg side to make himself room, and he cuts it in the air, deliberately, over the point region
backs away again and Hazlewood follows him with a back-of-a-length ball. Carved away over the cover region without quite middling it

back of a length outside off, and that's excellent from Sundar, taps it towards deep point, but doesn't hit it too hard, and calls immediately for two because the fielder has to come in a long way off the rope
short, angling down leg, can't connect with the flick off the hip
short ball gets up to just above chest height on off stump. Rides the bounce with both feet off the ground and defends with soft hands, right by his feet
ooh, a bit of late inswing as Starc fires in a middle-stump yorker. Watches it carefully and jabs it back to the bowler

gone, another excellent catch from Green at gully. Good ball from Starc, short and angling sharply into Washington. Got caught in two minds, between swaying away and trying to ramp it over gully, ended up doing the latter without a whole lot of conviction, and Green dives to his left to complete the catch. Superb innings on debut, he's brought the deficit down to 41. He's just 21, and there's so much time for him to expand on his sound batting and bowling fundamentals
greeted by a short ball first up, at his body. Backs away, almost turns his back on the ball, and offers a single-handed jab at it. Manages to keep it out and keep it down
good thinking from Siraj, steps across to the off side this time, looking to hoick the shortish off-stumpish ball towards fine leg. Can't connect, however
yorker just outside off, makes a lot of room and stabs it to deep point
half appeal for caught behind after Natarajan backs to the leg-side and pokes at a rising ball over off stump. Went past his glove
off the mark! Shortish on off stump, makes room and plays a tennis forehand to the left of mid-off
short over off stump, backs away to the leg side and swings mightily across the line, can't connect

shot. Not off the middle, but these are important runs. Makes a lot of room again, and Hazlewood goes to a fuller length on off stump. Scooped over mid-off, and they run two. Leaves Natarajan on strike for the next over, though
short, rising steeply over off stump. Backs away again, has a swish at it, and misses
short again, angling further in towards his elbow, manages to fend at it and keep it down in front of short leg
back of a length close to off stump, backs away and tries to stab at it, can't connect
short, angling down leg, jumps across and manages to get out of the way
full now, at the stumps, and Natarajan keeps his eye on it and jams his bat down to keep it out. Inside edge into pad
another yorker, this time it tails in late and hits low down on the front pad. Appeals, but not with a lot of conviction, because it's going down leg
shot! Gets leg-side of the bouncer and keeps his eye on it, manages to make contact with the ramp and it goes over the slips, too fine for third man to do anything about it
off-stump yorker, makes a lot of room and slaps it to deep point. Decides to keep the strike himself, which makes sense now.
now he steps to the off side to try and swat the short, off-stump ball towards fine leg. Second time he's tried it in two overs. The idea is right but again he fails to connect
bowled him. Hazlewood gets his five-for. Full, at the base of leg stump, and Siraj backs away, has a big slog at it, and misses
full, slanting away from off stump, left alone
back of a length, angling across to off stump, hops across and defends into the on side
back of a length on off stump, defended to short cover
fuller now, slanting into a wide-ish line outside off, inviting the drive. Left alone
full, down the leg side, can't connect with the flick
length ball angling away from off stump, left alone
Fullish, finds some swing away from Warner, but starts too wide to make him play. Similar start to the first innings
and again, swing away from the left-hander, but the initial line is a little too wide to make him play
and again. He needs to get closer to off stump to get that swing to bother Warner
too wide once again. Impressive swing and carry, but he's not found his radar yet

full, fifth-stump line, a bit of swing, Warner gets a big stride out and pushes into the covers. Thakur runs to his right from extra-cover/wide mid-off, picks up, spins, and throws at the non-striker's end, and a direct hit could have had the diving Warner in trouble. Nervy-looking single
back of a length outside off, left alone. Some swing on this one too
length ball, pitching on or around off and slanting away, left alone

and again, good line if you're looking to play on the patience of a team that wants to force a win. Pitching just outside off and continuing to slant away, asking the batsman if he wants to drive away from his body. Left alone
just a touch short on off stump, and Warner pounces, meeting the ball well in front of his body to pull wide of mid-on
shot. Length ball close to off stump, and he gets his weight forward, moving into a firm push to the left of mid-off
hat-trick of fours. Short, just outside off, but that's enough width for Warner, deft hands to cut it between gully and point
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended to midwicket
length ball, curling away in the fifth-stump channel, left alone
length ball straightening towards off stump, good stride forward to block into the on side of the pitch
shortish, angling into the hip, clipped watchfully to square leg
fullish, angling into middle stump, clipped to the left of square leg
full, angling down leg, can't put bat to ball as he looks to tickle it away

ooh, good ball. Full, swinging away in the fifth-stump channel. It's full enough to make Warner want to drive through the covers, but he doesn't get a front-foot stride in, and ends up slicing it wide of gully
flat length ball on off stump, blocked back down the pitch
a little slower, angling into middle and off, stretches out to block into the on side
short, spinning away into a wide line, reaches out and chops to backward point
once again short, closer to off stump this time, and Warner leans back to late-cut fine of backward point
flat on middle and off, goes back to block it back to the bowler
once again short and wide, the turn makes Warner check his cut and play it watchfully to backward point
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball and defends into the covers
length ball on off stump, gets back and across to defend down the pitch
length ball close to off stump, a hint of away shape, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, too far outside off to make Warner play. He's getting a lot more swing when his line is wide of off stump, frustratingly for him
back of a length on middle and off, clipped to the left of wide mid-on/straight midwicket
full, swinging away in the corridor, left alone
beaten first ball! Back of a length, angled across and nips off the seam, Warner feeling for it away from his body
short of a length on off stump, defended towards point
bang! Warner is away for the day. Long half volley from Siraj, he gets forward and drills it straight of mid-off
pulls the length back, outside off, left alone
that's a good one...short of a length at middle and off, moves away late to beat the outside edge
back of a length at middle and off, defended
full outside off, left alone
shorter, 129kph, left alone
edged, through the slips! That was an excellent delivery, angled in at off stump then held its line, takes the outside edge but doesn't reach Rohit or Pujara on the full
full outside off, gets forward and punches to mid-on
super shot! Gets forward and punches on the up straight of mid-off...that's textbook from Harris
drags the length back further outside off, hint of swing, left alone
full outside off, left alone
angled across, left alone
pushed wider outside the off stump, through to the keeper
edged, over second slip! Going Australia's way this morning. This leapt from short of a length outside off, Warner sparred at it and the edge flew just out of reach of a leaping Rohit
short of a length on leg stump, gets inside the line and works into square leg...Siraj chased that himself!
back of a length outside off, left alone
full at off stump, defended to mid-on
another edge, but well short of third slip...back of a length at off stump, draws an uncertain push from Harris
wider outside off, left alone
good area, full outside off, hint of shape and left alone
full, pushed down the leg side, Harris can't catch up with it
full, wide outside off, left alone. A maiden
full outside off, allows it to go through
short of a length at off stump, Warner on his toes and pushes towards point
angled across outside off and moves further away as Warner leaves alone
short of a length outside off, a short-arm jab-pull finds mid-on
full at middle, defended to mid-on
full at off stump, finds the middle as he plays it back to the bowler
lovely piece of timing, angled outside leg stump and Harris clips it strongly behind square...and it's a no-ball
down the leg side again, doesn't make contact with anything and evades the diving Pant. This moved significantly after pitching
three in a row! Over adjusts his line, short and wide outside off, driven square of the wicket from the back foot. That's trademark Harris
full at off stump, better line and length, defended to mid-on
back of a length outside off, tapped square of the wicket and there's a lot of space with the sweeper out
full at off stump, 130kph, defended on the front foot to mid-off followed by a loud call of 'no run'
short of a length outside off, holds its line as Warner leaves alone. Productive over for Australia
short outside off, another excellent shot by Harris, stands tall and square drives at the top of the bounce in front of point
very full outside off, driven off the toe end to mid-off
short of a length at leg stump, knocked into midwicket
angled across outside off, left alone
fantastic shot! He's looking good. Siraj comes round the wicket, goes full outside off, Harris gets onto the front foot and plays the perfect drive wide of mid-off
drags the length back, left alone
short of a length, worked off the hip to deep square leg
short again, defended to the on side
pushed wide outside off, 135kph, left alone
full outside off, through to the keeper
good length at off stump, gets forward and defends to mid-off
short outside off, Harris goes for the pull but it comes off the splice and goes back to the bowler
full at the pads, tapped into midwicket and again Siraj goes after it himself
good length at middle and off, 135kph, defended
short of a length at off stump, Harris a little squared up as he defends to point
length ball outside off, left alone
fuller at off stump, played into the off side
good length at middle stump, defended from the crease, slices across the shot slightly
round the wicket, full and straight, clipped into midwicket
this turns! Full outside off, Harris goes for a booming drive and is beaten. Bounces as well. Good take from Pant. Harris nearly topples out of is crease. Landed in a footmark
this goes straight on, left alone
worked into midwicket
full at off stump, this drive slices off the outer half of the bat to deep cover
angled in at middle and off, defended. Nice start
good length at off stump, defended
angled across, left alone
outside off, through to the keeper
short of a length, pushed into the off side, no chance of the single
just outside off, back of a length, a late cut from Harris which goes to gully
a beauty! Full at off stump, nips away off the seam to beat the outside edge
outside off, left alone
full at off stump, a strong whip through midwicket, Saini has to chase so a test for that groin. Certainly nowhere near full tilt
short of a length outside off, cut to backward point
outside off, left alone
lovely batting, superbly played, this slid on with the arm, a very delicate late cut from Harris down to third man. Lead is over 100
defended from off stump
what a ripper! That's unplayable. Short of a length at middle, jags away and climbs past Warner's outside edge
fuller at off stump, onto the front foot and pushes into the point area
short of a length, outside off, left alone
super shot, he's played some good ones this morning, onto the front foot and drives on the up into the covers
short of a length at middle and off, defended
on middle, back of a length, defended
full at off stump, driven to deep cover
floated up, pushed square on the off side
outside off, left alone
touch more bounce on this one, left alone
fuller at off stump, gets forward and works to mid-on
slides on outside off, left alone
beaten again! This zips through outside off, Warner pushing at it. Thakur thought he might have nicked it
jabs a very full delivery square into the off side
short of a length, tucked into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, goes for the late cut but he's cramped for room
another cracking drive...gets onto the front foot to a full delivery just outside off, places it wide of mid-off
short of a length, defended
full at off stump, defended into midwicket
touch of spin outside off, left alone
touch shorter, defended on the back foot
full at middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
drives to one of the two short covers
drives again and this time beats the short covers, out to the sweeper
worked off the hip to long leg
hops back in the crease and tucks a short-of-a-length delivery into midwicket
full at off stump, 138kph, driven to cover
good length outside off, hint of shape back, left alone
a bouncer outside leg stump, 136kph, he ducks underneath
full at off stump, defended to mid-off. Good over
left alone outside off
very full and nearly gets a leading edge back to the bowler as he looks to whip into the leg side
length ball outside off, gets forward and leaves alone
forward and defends with bat and pad together
this one straightens a touch on off stump, defended
full and driven to the on side. Sundar hustles through a maiden
short of a length down the leg side, Warner looks to flick it away but doesn't make contact
back of a length at middle and leg, turned to square leg
latches onto the short ball, short on off stump, sees it early and pulls through square leg
short again, but much shorter, Warner sways out of the line
short of a length, worked around the corner with the bottom hand coming off the bat
gloved behind! Short ball makes the breakthrough. Well directed over middle and leg, Harris tries to sway underneath but leaves his gloves up by his helmet and the ball brushes them through to Pant
past the outside edge. Some grip and bounce as this beats Warner's outside edge on the forward block
short of a length just outside off, chopped to backward point
past the short extra fielder! There are two catching fielders side-by-side there, and it looks like Warner's hit it between them. A right hand goes up from on of them but this drive is through them
length and into the stumps, defended
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot

Warner's been given lbw, trapped deep in the crease! Begins to walk off, then turns around and sneaks in a review. He's shaking his head so he isn't convinced he's safe here. But it might be worth the review. Sundar's got the arm ball to slide on from off and hit Warner's back thigh in front of off stump. He was shaping for the cut, for the one that turns. That's three reds on DRS. It's hitting off and middle and suddenly, the momentum's turned. What a series this is. The lovely little counterpunch from Warner ends. It's Thakur and Sundar bringing India back in again
good length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and rising in the corridor, left alone
short and just outside off, subdued pull into the turf, straight to square leg
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and just outside off, left alone
good length and into the stumps. Drops it pitch side with soft hands for the single
good length, turning in at leg stump. Defended off the back foot
short of a length and ripping into him. Backs a long way into the leg side for the punch but that gets too big on him
oh nicely placed. Short and a bit too wide. Turns in but not enough. He's onto the back foot and chops this past slip
length at off stump, steps out and flicks past short leg

steps out and lofts it over midwicket. Remember, he fell to a soft shot against Sundar in the first innings. No half-measures here, jumps down first ball to a length delivery dipping on leg stump. Goes through with the swing having not made the pitch of it
full at middle stump, swept firmly to backward square
good length and a bit of shape away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
full and onto the pads, shuffles and flicks to fine leg's left. Then takes on Natarajan's throw and gets a third run there. Smith's out there with the IntentTM
short one, a bit too short at a leg stump line. Lets that go

sweetly punched. Length ball slanted into the stumps. Stands tall and drives on the up and between non-striker and mid-on. Saini gives chase, a laboured chase, and has his knuckles mere centimetres from the boundary rope as he pulls this back in. On close inspection, the third umpire has decided that he's touched it at the same time as the ball
good length and some shape away in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
low full toss down leg side and he gets inside the line to tickle that past Pant
good length and dipping at middle and leg. Reaches out and jabs at it with hard hands, to mid-on
good length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length and skidding on at off stump. But he makes room brilliantly and jabs it past slip with an open face
crunched over deep mid-on! Whew, what a player. Sundar pushed this through at a length and it slid on nicely for Marnus as he stepped out and slapped it on the rise
good length at leg stump, gently pushed to backward square's left off the back foot
full at off stump, swept straight to square leg
short of a length just outside off, hurried cut into the covers
expertly steered past second slip. Short of a length and just outside off, gets into a half crouch and uses his wrists to find the gap in the cordon

taken at second slip this time! Siraj gets some extra bounce from a length and pins Marnus in the crease. He looks to defend this ball in the corridor, it gets big on him and straightens a touch. Straight into Rohit's pouch
good length at middle and leg, defended off the back foot
short of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot

Wade's walking! Caught down leg side. A full ball on the pads. Looks to flick that away and seems to have found the inside edge. Pant lunges to his right to hold on. Not even the thought of a review there, Wade is straight off
good length and turning into off stump, defended down the pitch off the back foot
good length at middle stump, steps out and jams it down towards to long-on

major mix-up but Green survives. Got a leading edge into the covers trying to punch this down to long.on. Took off for a run, almost instinctively. It was right by Sundar who couldn't get a throw away quickly enough because he was off balance
length at the stumps, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
length at middle stump, steps out and punches to mid-on
short of a length and turning into off stump, backs away and punches to mid-off's left
good length and into the corridor. Gets behind the line to defend, thick outside edge to deep point
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
good length and angled into the corridor, left alone
short of a length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length on off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
good length at middle stump, steps out and punches towards the non-striker
full on leg stump and swept viciously into Mayank Agarwal's left shin at short leg. He does have padding there but that's got him on the floor and requiring assistance
full on off stump, Smith eager for the drive through cover, gets a thick outside edge to backward point
length and down leg side, deep in the crease to dab this to fine leg
good length at off stump, steps out and jabs to mid-off's right
good length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side with the turn
good length and angled into the corridor, defended off the back foot
short of a length and cramped on an off stump line as he looks to pull behind square. Cops that on the box
short of a length and just outside off, punched into the covers from deep in the crease
short of a length just outside off, punched to cover off the back foot
length on off stump, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and into off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and just outside off. Defended to gully off the outside half
good length, from wide of the crease at 129kph, in at off stump. Defended into the covers
full at off stump, 132kph, driven to mid-off on the front foot
good length and wide outisde off, left alone
short of a length just outside off, 126kph, hurriedly patted towards cover
good length and wide outside off, 140kph and with some lift. Left alone
good length, 141.6kph and keeping a touch low at off stump. Defended towards mid-on
short of a length and middle, looks to pull and gets a deflection off the thigh to fine leg's right
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length in the corridor, blocked on the front foot
length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side with the angle
short and wide outside off, gets tight on him with the angle but he slashes this over the slip cordon
beaten on the outside edge. 127kph, good length and landing on the crack. Cuts away a long way
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
full and into off stump, shuffles and tucks this wide of mid-on
good length and just outside off, defended to gully's right off the outside half
good length and into off stump, nudged to mid-on's right with the angle
good length and cutting away from outside off, left alone
good length and down leg side, walks down at it and is too far away for the flick

big appeal for lbw but Green is struck outside off. Or so I thought. India have taken the review. It's a length ball curving in from wide of the crease. Green has walked a long way down the pitch for the flick. Struck on the knee roll and third umpire has ascertained there's no bat on it. It's umpire's call on impact, and the ball is missing the wickets. India lose the review
good length and in at the stumps, defended to mid-on
good length and jumping in at him as he looks to force this into the leg side with the angle
short of a length and into the corridor, inside edge onto boot as he looks to defend
full at off stump, 132kph, shuffles and flicks it wide of mid-on. He's overstepped
full and into the corridor, defended down the pitch
good length outside off, 130kph, left alone
swished fine. Short, 129kph, and into his hips. Swivels rapidly and gets this pull down to the fine leg boundary
short of a length outside off, straightening. Left alone
lbw appeal turned down as Smith shoulders arms and is struck outside off. Wasn't offering a shot so the appeal was on, but Saini hadn't brought that back in enough. Looked high as well
good length at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
good length and a bit too wide to make him play, left alone
good length at off stump, defended with the angle to mid-on

uff, perhaps only Smith could have conceived this. Short of a length and very tight in the corridor. He shuffles and it's into his mid-riff. He gets an awkwardly angled bat and a short-arm pull, through midwicket
good length in the corridor, defended down the pitch
short of a length and wide outisde off, cut to backward point off the under-edge
tight leave! On off stump, nips back, carries just over the timber. He trusts the bounce
short of a length, on his toes and defends
outside off, a more comfortable leave
fuller at the stumps, a firm on-drive to mid-on
full outside off, nice line, in the channel outside off and left alone
wider, through to the keeper. A maiden to start the afternoon
round the wicket, on the stumps, worked off the pads to long and he races back for the second. Has to get the dive out
length ball, worked from around off stump into midwicket
angles this down the leg side
down the leg side again, Smith gets inside the line and leaves alone
full at off stump, the bat faces closes and he squeezes to midwicket
full and straight, tucked around the corner down to fine leg
good length at off stump, defended to midwicket
short of a length, touch wider, defended to cover
short outside off, drives square to deep point
punched off the back foot to the bowler
short of a length outside off, driven sweetly but straight to cover
beats the edge, feeling for this away from his body, still a touch of movement for Thakur. Quiet start since lunch
full outside off, leans back and drives square to point
works a straight delivery to midwicket
full at the stumps, 131kph, played to midwicket
full at off stump, looked like a bit of cutter, defended
into middle and leg, worked off the pads to square leg
full at off stump, played back down the pitch
full at the stumps, flicked around the corner and Rohit makes a good diving save at leg gully
back of a length, pushed into a gap at midwicket
there's the first real sign of aggression since the break, short outside off, Smith pulls it in the air well in front of square
back on a full length at the stumps, nudged into midwicket
full at middle and off, defended
full at off stump, played back down the pitch, Thakur slips in his followthrough
short of a length, worked in front of mid-on
gets a good stride forward and drives wide of mid-off
full outside off, tapped square into the covers
pushed away from full at off stump into the covers
gets that stride forward again, drives with an open face and the ball runs backward of point
back of a length, Smith across outside off and defends
full at off stump, driven to mid-off as he loses his shape a bit
uses his feet, misses his flick to leg but that's going down leg
pushes this down the leg side
starts to use his feet, this is fired outside leg and he almost struggles to reach it
flicks through midwicket this time, wide enough of long-on for the second...Australia's lead beyond 200
works a straight delivery into square leg
great shot! That's a gem. Skips down the pitch and dills a drive wide of mid-off
back of a length from round the wicket, defended
ooh, this scuttles through...short of a length outside off, keeps very low and just beats off stump. Must have hit a crack
and this one nips back, bounces a touch more, Green trying to get well forward
strangled appeal for lbw...going down or did he hit it? Angling from round the wicket, does have to do a bit to get that lbw
short of a length, nips back again, Green takes one in a delicate spot
angling into the pads, flicked to square leg, can't beat a well-packed field. A maiden.

dropped! At long-on by Siraj. Smith coming down the track, wasn't to the pitch, tried to go straight down the ground...Siraj came in first and had come in too far. Palms it for four. That could be costly
paddled down to fine leg
defended on the back foot
flicked into midwicket
uses his feet then pushes to the off side
back and across, defends, Green continues his cautious approach
back of a length, punched into the off side, gets it just wide of a diving mid-off
full at off stump, 132kph, defended
back of a length outside off, chopped into the pitch off the bottom edge
a short ball, Green gets inside the line and goes for a hook but doesn't make contact
good length at off stump, played into midwicket
angled into the pads, flicked away fine...no bat involved
tucked into midwicket
fuller, he comes forward and defends to short mid-on
worked off the pads backward of square and that's Smith's fifty from 67 balls
driven towards mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
short of a length, turned to short leg
defended to the leg side
short of a length outside off, defended on the back foot
well bowled, draws Green across the crease and beats the outside edge
full at off stump, drives and finds point
dropped! In his followthrough by Siraj. Drives at a length delivery, struck it quite nicely, went straight down the pitch and Siraj couldn't hold it to his right
back of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length outside off, this keeps a little low although Green was also playing on the back foot
defends a straight delivery to midwicket
full outside off, brings a drive from Smith, flies off a thick outside down to third man...nicely bowled
outside leg stump, worked into short fine leg
uses his feet and clips to one of the two short midwickets
starts to use his feet again, adjusts late and dabs this backward of point when the delivery is shorter
strong shot! Goes down on his back knee and sweeps this from around off stump through square leg. Green's first boundary
good length outside off, defended

this leaps, and is fended to gully! Hang on a moment, Smith thinks this may have hit the glove when it was off the bat handle and has called the review. It leapt off the pitch from back of a length...and, nope, the glove was certainly on the handle at point of impact. He could nothing about that, really, and it looped to Rahane. Australia's quicks won't mind seeing that
full at off stump, out of the middle straightaway and pushed back down the pitch
and another! This leaps again from back of a length. Paine rips his bottom hand off the bat, this one loops into space.
outside off, back of a length, Paine cautiously tries to get forward, bottom hand comes off the bat as he defends
full outside off, drives with the feet slightly stuck in the crease. Superb over
uses his feet then defends
full at off stump, clips it straight of the midwickets down to long-on
on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
goes on with the air outside off, pushed square
uses his feet again then pushes back to the bowler
another powerful sweep, gets it wide of the backward square...nice connection
good length and into the corridor, gets forward and pushes gingerly into the covers
good length and into the corridor, dropped pitch side with soft hands
full at middle stump, punched out to mid-on
good length and sliding onto the pad. Flicked to fine leg with the angle
full and just outside off, driven firmly to mid-off
full and just outside off, leans in for the drive but gets it off the toe-end. Extra cover slides to the right to parry it for mid-off. Been hard going for Green, the timing continues to desert him
full and slanted in at off stump, plants the front leg across and clips it to mid-on's right
short and wide and right on top of that before he chops it to the point boundary. No venom in these deliveries from Saini, with his groin problem
good length and just outside off, defended into the covers
good length and in at off stump, tentative with his defence down the pitch
good length and catching him on the thigh guard as he looks to tickle this fine
full and floated in at off stump. Shuffles across off stump and drives this to mid-on's right. Sundar is beaten on the dive and then gives chase to pull it back
short of a length and spitting up at an off stump line. Defended into the covers
short of a length outside off, cut into the covers
short of a length outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on's right with soft hands
bouncer at an off stump line, ducks to leave
full and just outside off, driven along the ground to mid-off
good length and into off stump, 129kph, shuffles and pushes to midwicket's right
good length in the corridor, shuffles and defends down the pitch
classy. Stands nice and tall and punches this on the rise, between non-striker and mid-on. Wasn't a full ball by any means, was up at about knee height and he drove on the rise
these are throwdowns at this point. Saini, nowhere near full fitness, is floating up driving balls at 130kph. Paine has this right under his eyes and gets the on-drive away
short of a length and just outside off, cut to deep point
falls just short of midwicket. Full and into the pads. Paine eager on the flick, goes early and with hard hands. It dies on Gill who lunges forward
good length outside off, punched to extra cover's right
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot

another catch for Rohit. Must be his fourth of the match. (Edit:fifth) Short of a length and rising in the corridor. Green has a stab at that and gets a healthy edge that carries to second slip at hip height. That's the last of Green's batting in this series, and perhaps one of his hardest knocks too. It's been a good display at international level so far, but got stuck today
full and just outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, pushed towards mid-on with the turn
full on off stump, driven to mid-off against the turn
low full toss at leg stump, flicked out to deep square's left
length and outside leg stump, pads it past leg slip
short of a length and turning in from middle stump. Cummins shaping for the back foot punch, cops that on the thigh
and this one goes away. Cummins stuck on the back foot playing for the one that comes in, but this is an arm ball beating his outside edge
length outside off, leans in for the drive into the covers
short of a length outside off, punched into the covers off the back foot
length and wide outside off, left alone
length and wide outside off, left alone
yorker at leg stump, hurriedly dug out towards mid-on
short and down leg side, can't get bat on the attempted pull
good length and turning in from outside off, gets forward for the block and is struck on the pad outside off
good length and spinning down from middle stump. Gets forward with soft hands and tickles this fine
reverse sweep in front of point. Good length and at leg stump, reaches out with the same grip and isn't quite low enough, but watches it nicely to whip that away
good length and down leg side, left alone with a late attempt at a backheel with his right leg
short of a length and into the body as he looks to play the glance
short and turning into the body, jumps into the leg side and cuts to sweeper point
kicks up from short of a length again. Just outside off as he looks to steer this behind gully. Gets the on the glove
short of a length and wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, goes too hard on the cut. Miscues it as a result but that gets him two to cover's left
short of a length and curving away from off stump, defended into the off side. Got squared up there
good length at middle stump, defended solidly on the front foot
given out caught behind. Short ball climbing steeply outside off. Paine brings out the pull but that's caught the top edge and Pant has done well to leap and hold on to this one
falls short of first slip. Reaches out on the front foot outside off, the edge dies on the fielder
good length and into leg stump, pushed to midwicket
length and wide outside off, left alone
full and into the corridor, driven on the up to mid-off
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length and just outside off, has a stab at that from the crease and is beaten
short of a length on leg stump, clipped towards fine leg
starts with a short ball, he ducks underneath
short of a length and down the leg side
short and wide, he throws his hands and it and the top edge flies over the slips to third man
he's struck by this short one! Didn't bounce as much as he expected, tried to go underneath and it takes him on the back of the helmet. So he'll need to be checked
short again, angles down the leg side and Cummins gets inside the line
short of a length, defended on the back foot
a swing and a miss at a length ball angled across
taken at mid-off! Full on off stump, Starc goes in the air but doesn't get enough on it and that's a simple catch above the head
there's the Lyon on-drive again! Lovely stroke, eases forward to a full delivery outside off...not quite the legs for a boundary this time
back of a length outside off, forced off the back foot and gully makes a good save
edged, but doesn't carry to second slip...back of a length angling to Cummins, it went down off the edge
back of a length at off stump, defended
fuller at the stumps, tucked just wide of mid-on
nips back into Cummins, defended
back of a length outside off, steered through point with an open face, there is a sweeper out
short of a length, pulled to mid-on
short again, angling into the hip, pulled around the corner
full at middle, 134kph, defended
this comes back miles! Short of a length, cuts Cummins in half, takes the inside edge past the stumps and wide of Pant. Hit the crack. An offbreak at 135kph
short of a length, pulled through square leg
nice flick of the wrists sends this behind square from around off stump
a short ball which he sways out of the way of
another bouncer, well over Cummins...late call of wide, in fact
angled in at middle and leg, defended
short of a length, a nice swivel pull to deep square
ducks underneath another shot one
goes after this short one, flies over the top edge of an attempted pull
short and wide, through to the keeper...called wide again. Actually a no-ball for three short balls in a row
short again, pulled strongly through midwicket
back of a length, wide outside off, Lyon wafts at it
full at the stumps, 134kph, driven to mid-off
full at off stump, driven and can't beat mid-off
back of a length and angling in, swung to deep square...Australia's lead goes to 300
short, hooked and all the way! At the body, gets just inside it and helps it over fine leg...maybe more top edge than middle
goes for the yorker, it's a low full toss that swings in, takes a thick inside edge to deep square
full and straight, gives himself some room and heaves to mid-on
back of a length, straight, Cummins misses his heave to leg and is nearly bowled. Signs from Australia?
flayed to cover...short of a length outside off, Lyon tries to drive off the back foot and can't keep it down
back of a length at middle and leg, takes a thick outside edge along the ground to gully
full at the stumps, pushed to mid-on
touch shorter, popped in the air to the on side
through the off side! Full, very wide, Hazlewood reaches out, can barely get to the ball, and slots away the cover drive
defends a length delivery
full at leg stump, driven firmly back at the bowler
gives himself room against a length delivery, a slower delivery, swings through the line and it has the legs to clear long-on
angled in at leg stump, defended as he moves outside leg
hammered down the ground, mid-off is just able to get a hand on it
short of a length, down the leg side, not too far from the gloves as Cummins tries to pull
back of a length at the stumps, played to the bowler...Hazlewood a long way down and Siraj regrets not throwing at the stumps
over the top edge as he moves to leg and aims to ramp it
short of a length, upper cuts this over gully and wide of third man
short of a length, straight, pushed into the off side
short and straight, called wide
full outside off, a slower ball, Cummins is just able to reach it as he gives himself room and lobs it down the ground
short outside off, Hazlewood attempts a square cut and is beaten
low full toss at off stump, aiming for the yorker, driven to mid-off and Cummins sends Hazlewood back
heaves a length ball out to deep square leg...and again they don't run
angled in at leg stump, takes a thick edge and is cut off by Rohit diving at first slip
short of a length, played square into the off side, they want a second to deep cover but then decide against it and Cummins is nearly run out
cracked away! Leave it to Hazlewood. A length ball outside off, steps to leg and frees his arm through a meaty drive wide of mid-off

taken at third man...Siraj has his five! Short of a length, Hazlewood went for the ramp and sent it straight to the field. Thakur, who also had four wickets to his name, helps his fellow fast bowler complete the haul
short of a length, defended down by his feet, Starc immediately turns and look at the crease
short again, 138kph, on the back foot and plays it down into the crease...Starc not thrilled by his take-off area
full, wide outside off at 140kph, left alone
good length, angled across outside off, left alone...can he get one to shape back?
full outside off, Rohit gets onto the front foot and drives this perfectly through the covers
full at middle, defended
short of a length, straight, defended
full outside off, some nice shape away, left alone
back of a length at off stump, 132kph, defended
on middle, not quite full enough, defended to the on side
that's a good one, in the channel outside off, this zips through to Paine as Gill pulls the bat inside the line
back of a length, straight, pushed firmly to mid-on
short of a length at off stump, hops behind the line and works to short leg
outside off, back of a length at 138kph, defended
touch fuller, Rohit stays reasonably deep in the crease as he defends
back of a length at middle and off, 140kph, defended...perhaps just needs to go a touch fuller with the new ball
good length, angling in at off stump, defended square into the off side
this may have kept a fraction low, back of a length, nips back towards the stumps, Rohit is able to work into midwicket
length ball at off stump, 131kph, played to the on side
in the channel outside off, steered towards backward point and after some hesitancy they get through for the single
back of a length outside off, punched firmly to the covers
outside off, perhaps a hint of movement, playing off the back foot a little way from his body, runs this through gully
full at the stumps, clipped through square leg without perfect timing
shorter, outside off, played to the on side from the back foot
length ball, straight, tucked into the leg side with a closed face
full outside off, a very sweet drive finds mid-off
good length just outside off, brings him forward as he defends to cover
fuller, at middle, 140kph, defended back to the bowler
neatly played, gets onto the back foot to a short-of-a-length delivery and punches wide of mid-off
big seam movement this time, nips back into Rohit and takes him high on the pads
back of a length, straight, defended
fuller at off stump, 135kph, defended on the front foot to cover
full outside off, driven to mid-off...no significant movement in the air yet today, although that isn't the main weapon for Hazlewood and Cummins
dropped in short, he goes after it with a pull well in front of square...outfield a touch slow after the heavy rain
well bowled, goes fuller at the stumps, Rohit caught on the crease, takes him high on the back leg
full outside off, defended
full at off stump, Gill gets a little squared up as he defends
what a delivery! That's unplayable. Full length, angling in at off stump, then moves away late to beat the edge
back of a length, straight, defended to the on side
on off stump, defended on the back foot
short of a length, stays on the back foot and defends down the pitch
and again, defended with a high elbow, back down the pitch
full at off stump, played with a straight bat and it runs into midwicket
good length at off stump, Gill has looked pretty comfortable defending those off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended
angled in at the stumps, played to the on side...needs to bring him onto the front foot
that's the length, full outside off, well watched by Gill as he shoulders arms and Paine takes it on the rise above his head
good length, angling in at off stump, gets a small stride forward and defends
full at off stump, 139kph, defended to mid-on

edged, gone! It's Cummins, as it is so often. In the channel just outside off, brings him forward, it's a healthy outside edge, Paine takes a good diving catch in front of first slip. Rohit may consider he could have left that
in the same spot outside off, Pujara raises the bat out of the line
this comes back! Starts outside off and jags in off stump, but carries well over the stumps
good length outside off, 140kph, left alone
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length, nips back off the seam, brings a strangled shout from the slips but it's done too much and is probably high as well
full outside off, left alone
full, angling into middle and leg, clipped off the pads behind square
too much width outside off, Gill plays a slashing square cut, flies high over backward point
fuller, at off stump, defended to mid-on
short of a length, stays leg side of it and punches firmly to the off side...there was a run there but it's not taken with a bit of confusion between the pair
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, defended with an open face into the gully...Pujara sets off and is sent back by Gill
pushed up even fuller, played into the covers...this pair look a little twitchy between the wickets
angled in at off stump, 139kph, good length and defended to the on side
a short ball, ducks underneath...good set from Cummins
in the channel outside off, left alone
full, angled into the pads, clipped through midwicket
full outside off, driven to the covers
very full, almost a yorker, worked to mid-on
short of a length outside off, left alone
touch fuller, outside off, nice line and length, left alone
nicely bowled, length ball outside off, this one nips back and isn't too far from off stump as Pujara leaves alone
back of a length at off stump, 139kph, defended
touch fuller, Gill caught a little back in the crease, takes the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
full at middle and off, 142kph, pushed firmly back to the bowler
a bouncer, 140kph, he ducks underneath
good length at off stump, gets forward and defends
